Accepting her impending death, Mab transformed her body into a city, creating Edinburg, the capital of the northern fae. And from that humus of fae that lasted for thousands of years, Cnoc na Riabh was born.

As Cnoc na Riabh was born the great faerie Mab's clone, she made it her personal mission to protect not just the northern fae, but all fae in Faerie Britain. 

As she was born from many sacrifices, Cnoc na Riabh vowed to herself that she would not live life for herself until the ideal nation was established. She even sealed away her own feelings of love, though she always longed for it, and continued to expand her subjects from the King Clan in the Queen City Edinburg. In the process, she met another faerie girl who was also bound by destiny, Altria Caster, and they became fast friends. They even began a friendly rivalry, and competed to see who would fulfill their destiny and find happiness first.

Cnoc na Riabh's time as Mab's successor was difficult, but the presence of Altria Caster putting on a strong face even though she was a similar situation was a saving grace for Cnoc na Riabh. (The responsibility of being Mab's successor was difficult, but she did not hate it because her pride made her to believe that the mission was also worthwhile.)

Cnoc na Riabh, by all accounts, was thought to have been lost in Faerie Britain, showed up as a Servant! Could she be an enemy? An ally? Or a chairwoman of the committee? Turns out she was really Cnoc na Riabh.

Wandjina, the great spirit of the atmosphere overlooking Hawaltria, was unable to communicate with humans. The guardian of the sacred sword sensed Wandjina's plea and so introduced the spirit to her best friend, thinking Cnoc na Riabh could serve as an intermediary between Wandjina and humans. And while Cnoc na Riabh did not exist in Proper Human History, it was AA's personal wish to have her fill that role. She wanted to have her experience another glamorous festival, even if only for a moment...

And that was how Cnoc na Riabh, who would not normally be recognized as a Heroic Spirit in Proper Human History, appeared in the land of Hawaltria.

Motivation, behavior towards Master

If Master is male, Cnoc na Riabh will fall hard. Love at first sight.

If Master is female, Cnoc na Riabh will be BFFs with her. She will be so close with Master, she'll say things like, "We're going to race to see who can snag the best man! If you win, I'll arrange for you to take a trip around the world!"

When she appears in "Servant Summer Festival 2025!" she does not retain any memories from Faerie Britain, but tries to be proactive in her dealings with Master. Because Cnoc na Riabh grew up knowing her predecessor Mab's great love and dreamed of experiencing something similar herself, she has a strong desire to be united with a human being and find happiness this time around.

Spirit Origin for Noble Phantasm Enhancement.
Can only be used as an NP Enhancement material to raise the NP level of the target Servant.

Wandjina exists high above the world, observing its surface from its skies. At times, Wandjina becomes the blessed water that falls from the skies to soak the earth, enriching all life below.

This ancient spirit is believed to have existed since the Mesozoic era, when dinosaurs still roamed the world. The rainy season and rain...the source of life.

A great spirit to surpass all others...that is Wandjina. Artwork depicting this great spirit can be found in the Kimberley region of northwestern Australia.

While Wandjina already existed on a truly grand scale, an encounter with the Servant Universe granted Wandjina the aspect of a guardian protecting the seven water stars. And so was born Wandjina the Space Spirit.

Height/Weight: 153cm, ???kg
Origin: Aboriginal Mythology, Fate/Grand Order
Region: Australia, Servant Universe
Alignment: Chaotic-Good
Sub-Attribute: Heaven
Gender: ― (Appears female)
Wandjina claims the koala that hangs on her arm is not a koala, but a boomerang.

She's full of energy! She loves humans! But she was invisible, unable to interact with humans, which consigned her to eons of boredom. With her manifestation as a Servant, Wandjina gained a temporary body humans could perceive, leaving her positively bursting with excitement. (And after learning humans teeter on the verge of extinction, she gets very upset.)

She typically looks like an innocent, energetic child with a perpetual smile on her face. Her mentality is about what one might expect from her appearance. But, on rare occasions, when she is truly enraged, she demonstrates uncontrollable aggression. This is likely owed to Wandjina being connected with weather. And so she is an embodiment of both clouds of gentle rain and raging storms. However, this aggression is generally directed against those who abuse nature and humans, so it is safe to think of them as a calm, cheerful Servant.

Nature's Droplet: B
A skill noting Wandjina's position as a great spirit, or a powerful being from ancient times. Wandjina is believed to be the cause of humanity's creation. She loves humans, but typically humans cannot perceive or interact with her.

Blessings of Life: B+
The great spirit Wandjina is believed to be tied to the very foundation of human life. This is a skill that grants blessings and protection to humans and their allies.

Watcher of the Water Stars: A
Formerly a skill called "Rainy Incarnation." Wandjina in Australia was said to have ruled the rainy clouds, or monsoon clouds. When she manifested in Etherspace, Wandjina became the guardian of the seven earth-like planets, each of which had a surface which was seventy percent water. Thus, the skill "Rainy Incarnation" changed into the current skill, "Watcher of the Water Stars."

『Wandjina Mamaragan Seven Stars』
Rank: B+
NP Type: Anti-Personnel/Anti-Army
Range: 1-20
Maximum Target: 1 or 40

Wandjina's Fury.
As an incarnation of the rainy season and spirit which controls monsoon clouds, and now the guardian of the seven watery stars, Wandjina is able to unleash her anger in the form of bolts of lightning that pierce her enemies. Mamaragan is the name of a lightning god from Australian Aboriginal mythology. This Noble Phantasm itself also grants Wandjina the capacity to manifest as a Lancer.

At first glance, Wandjina looks like a being from outer space...an alien, frankly. There is the SLIGHT possibility Wandjina looks this way because a certain individual possessing Fae Eyes who miraculously perceived her during their time on Earth in the past and so manifested in a way which reflected their vision of an "alien descending to Earth." 

According the research of mages in the Clock Tower, Wandjina is a natural phenomenon that's been conceptualized, and is considered to be similar to the gods who governed nature in the Age of Gods. Specifically, Wandjina is a spirit on a truly incredible scale, equivalent to a supreme being of myth. Some argue that beings like this should be differentiated from conventional spirits and instead be called "Great Spirits" or "Super Spirits." This contention may not be too far off, based how the Servants who know or were from the Age of Gods refer to Wandjina. The latest categorization by Chaldea also designates Wandjina as a "Great Spirit." 

(As a side note, Heroic Spirits from the Servant Universe, such as Mysterious Heroine XX, call the current Wandjina "Space Spirit.")

First introduced in "Fae Round Table Domain, Avalon le Fae," this Servant was summoned to Britain to defeat Morgan, the ruler of Faerie Britain. Oberon has been known in the British Isles since ancient times, but this version strongly resembles his portrayal in Shakespeare's "A Midsummer Night's Dream."

He is fairly capable in combat, but excels in intelligence gathering and combat support, risking life and limb to ensure the success of Chaldea's mission. This trusty faerie king puts his heart and soul into securing Britain's true future.

His true identity is not a Heroic Spirit from Proper Human History, but a Servant born in Faerie Britain. He is a doomsday device that curses the world, born from the Abyssal Wyrm of Fae British legend said to return all to nothingness. The name Oberon was simply taken from Proper Human History.
His name in the Faerie Kingdom is Vortigern, and he shares the same name as King Vortigern, the tyrant who led Britain to destruction by selling off the nation to various tribes. 

Oberon the big liar. His existence and even his name are lies. When his true nature is revealed, he declares without a hint of shame, "I have nothing I like," as the edges of his mouth curl upward.
...Obviously, this is a lie as well, since not a single thing he says is true.

Height/Weight: 174cm, 56kg (when human)  17cm, 6kg (when Fae)
Origin: Germanic folklore, medieval European literature
Region: Faerie Britain
Alignment: Chaotic-Evil
Sub-Attribute: Earth
Gender: Male
"My True Name? Let me think...Faerie King Oberon is nice, but the more names I have, the more convenient it is for me. Winter Prince, or maybe Robin Goodfellow... There's a lot of them, you know."

Height/Weight: 174cm, 56kg (when human)  Total length 1440km, --kg (when Wyrm)
Origin: Faerie Britain, Fate/Grand Order
Region: Faerie Britain
Alignment: Chaotic-Evil
Sub-Attribute: Earth
Gender: Male
"My True Name? Yeah, it's also Vortigern. So what? Don't you remember me saying that having more names, the better?"

Perhaps the most famous depiction of Oberon is of the fairy king who appears in the Shakespearean comedy, "A Midsummer Night's Dream." In the play, Oberon is described as powerful, but with a selfish and immature disposition.

"A Midsummer Night's Dream" follows two lovers named Lysander and Hermia as chaos erupts around them over the course of a single night. The Oberon of the play quarrels with his queen, Titania, over her new page, and to punish her, Oberon plans to use a concoction that causes one to fall in love with the first person they lay eyes on, and then make the page his own. However, the juice was entrusted to a fairy servant named Robin Goodfellow, whose negligence caused Lysander and Demetrius to be affected by the juice...

　　◆

Oberon has been mentioned in numerous other works as well. In a 15th century work titled "Huon of Bordeaux," he was portrayed as a king of the forest of fairies who could use magic which granted all types of wishes.

There is a forest called the Autumn Woods, located in Wales, on the outskirts of Faerie Britain. It is inhabited by powerless insectoid faeries, or small fairies whose innocence and low intelligence made them unable to assimilate with the faeries of Britain who had taken to mimicking human society. Faeries who felt out of place in Faerie Britain, faeries who fled because they were bullied, and faeries who were persecuted for simply existing and reviled for "spreading poison" also gathered in this forest, and ended up dying helplessly. It was in this forest inhabited by "those who had nowhere else to go", or "those who were hated and died in obscurity"...that the Vortigern of this age―Oberon―emerged.

A beautiful young man with gentle blue eyes, silver hair, and pale skin. He's mild-mannered, sprightly, and a kind-hearted pacifist. His judiciousness makes him meticulous and careful in planning and executing strategies, but he never misses the exact right moment to make his move. He approaches situations bullishly and aggressively (some may see it as savagery).

He resembles a perfect prince of light straight out of a fairy tale. Simply put, he's a cunning main character, as proven by his mature smile but boyish behavior, or the fact that he is like an innocent visionary but possesses the authority and power of an adult. He is educated but not patronizing, idealistic but not militant, weak but not dependent on violence. He is the greatest prince of light of all faerie history, but he will not take a wife. 

"I like being happy. Just like bugs require clean water, faeries can't live without being happy."

Oberon is a Servant born from the British Isles, as well as being a doomsday device (Vortigern) created by the British Isles. He appeared as numerous forms of malice in the past (the mors king being one of them), and led the British Isles to destruction. Once Morgan's Era of the High Queen began, he was thwarted twice, which led to the creation of "Oberon."

He is popular with Britain's faeries because of his resemblance to the Wind and Wing clans, the most noble of all clans in Faerie Britain, but he is not a faerie at all. In fact, he is a single insect (ignobly) born from the emotional excrement embodying the island's revulsion for living things, disgust that a long-dead history has continued for over 10,000 years, and the desire to eliminate everything that lives on the island as well as all traces of the island itself.

In an ironic turn of events, when the British Isles produced the ancient faerie Oberon, his Spirit Origin overlapped with that of the Fairy King Oberon thanks to the influence of Proper Human History that Morgan brought in. This is how his purpose as a doomsday device and his nature as Oberon the King of Faeries are able to coexist.

Territory Creation: E-
A mage's ability to create their own workshop/territory. Oberon was once the king of the faerie forest, but as time passed, he lost his territory and became nothing more than a wanderer in a story. Consequently, his Territory Creation skill is at the lowest rank and paradoxically shows Oberon to be a king in name only. Oberon himself conceals this fact, and so he tries never to reveal that his Territory Creation abilities are low.

Item Construction: A+
The ability to create items. He becomes a high-ranking artisan who can create items that can confound the thoughts of others, as exemplified in the "tri-colored dew grass (love-in-idleness)" used to curse the fairy queen Titania.

Riding: A
In English faerie lore, faeries are said to travel by riding insects. Since Oberon is a king, he travels gracefully using his own wings, but he rides a sphingidae, more commonly known as a hawk moth (traveling at speeds of 130km/hr), when nobody is watching, racing to various lands and charming the hearts and minds of their people.

A beautiful young man with gentle blue eyes, silver hair, and pale skin. He's mild-mannered, sprightly, and a kind-hearted pacifist. His judiciousness makes him meticulous and careful in planning and executing strategies, but he never misses the exact right moment to make his move. He approaches situations bullishly and aggressively (some may see it as savagery).

He resembles a perfect prince of light straight out of a fairy tale. Simply put, he's a cunning main character, as proven by his mature smile but boyish behavior, or the fact that he is like an innocent visionary but possesses the authority and power of an adult. He is educated but not patronizing, idealistic but not militant, weak but not dependent on violence. He is the greatest prince of light of all faerie history, but he will not take a wife. 

"I like being happy. Just like bugs require clean water, faeries can't live without being happy."

Evening Shroud: EX
When night falls, the allied party experiences great success and a sense of escape from reality which leads to an increase in their will to fight. This skill is almost identical to Merlin's Dreamlike Charisma.

Morning Lark: EX
When morning breaks, the allied party experiences a great increase in morale and self-worth. This is a type of forced doping which increases the target's magical energy, though only temporarily. The effect is lost with time, so deploy Noble Phantasms with great caution...

Divinity: -
Oberon's queen, Titania, is formed from a combination of numerous fairies and goddesses (Mab, Diana, Titan), and thus she possesses Divinity. Oberon is a faerie king without any other elements mixed in, so he has not acquired Divinity.

『Lie Like Vortigern』
Rank: EX
NP Type: Anti-World
Range: Unlimited
Maximum Targets: Unlimited

Eye of a Dream Falling Yonder.
The true form and Noble Phantasm of the Oberon brought into existence by Faerie Britain. He transforms into the hollow insect tasked with Britain's destruction—the evil dragon Vortigern—and he swallows the entire world with his giant blender-like mouth and esophagus (hollow) to bring it to ruin. It doesn't kill the targets, but rather serves as a path to another world which plunges them into an abyss devoid of any light.


Ending of Dreams: EX
The terminal dream. A skill that enhances a single Servant. The affected Servant's abilities are augmented to an extraordinary degree, but at the end of the turn, all effects expire and the target falls into an eternal slumber.

...Those who lose their dreams shall never regain the will to awaken back to reality.

『Rye Rhyme Goodfellow』
Rank: E
NP Type: Anti-Personnel
Range: 5–40
Maximum Targets: 7

Tale of a Dream Held Aloft Yonder.
Oberon's rhyme of an unfinished paradise. He spreads his wings magnificently and scatters scales everywhere to forcibly transform the target's body (Spirit Origin) into a mental corpus of the dream world, and so prevents them from functioning in the real world. It is a grand magecraft that is superficially similar to a Reality Marble...or so he claims.  Those who fall into a dream become Invincible in exchange for becoming unable to intervene in reality.

Fae Eyes: -
A form of vision, innate to faeries, which "converts the world." It is different than the Mystic Eyes some humans possess. These are said to be the eyes of greater faeries who can pierce through all falsehoods and reveal the truth, and they show Oberon the malice, flaws, and inner nature of intelligent beings.

Anti-Humanity: D
The power to put a hold on all things humanity produces and the laws that work in humanity's favor. Normally the Beast class possesses this skill. Despite being unable to hate or hold a grudge against humanity, Oberon's eagerness and desire to eradicate humanity is as instinctive as breathing. This enabled him to acquire the same skills as the Evils of Humanity after eons of deception and biding his time. Simply put, it is a form of malice that subtly seduces the direction (or the mood) of the target's hearts and minds toward baser, more evil things.

Furthermore, he is on profoundly poor terms with Merlin, another resident of the dream world. Oberon rejects all support and aid from Merlin. This rift was born of their different attitudes toward your tale, and Oberon dedicates almost all his powers of disguise to deceive Merlin. Thus, Merlin is unable to perceive Oberon, and whenever someone speaks to Oberon through Clairvoyance, Merlin sees that person as simply speaking to themself.

Midsummer Night's Dream: EX
The curse Oberon has been inflicted with ever since his inception. 

"While these visions did appear; / And this weak and idle theme, / no more yielding but a dream."

One of the world's most famous fairy plays, "A Midsummer Night's Dream," closes with this soliloquy, which is also representative of Oberon's nature. In human history, the Fairy King's every word and action have been labeled as lies, cursing him to forever be unable to speak truth.

　　　◆

"Those damn bastards. I'll destroy them all one day."
Oberon's aggression stems neither from jealousy, nor from hatred, but rather from his love for Titania. However, he will never admit to this aloud.

History remembers Hephaistíon as Iskandar, the King of Conquerors', most beloved confidant and retainer. This...is not that Hephaistíon.

She is a mysterious mage from the Age of Gods who pledged unending loyalty to Iskandar, but at the same time hated the king and his army more than anyone else.

Height/Weight: 168cm, 58kg
Origin: History, "Lord El-Melloi II's Case Files"
Region: Macedonia
Alignment: Neutral-Balanced
Sub-Attribute: Earth
Gender: Female
Usually, you'd expect to see the real Hephaistíon summoned instead of her.

The younger sister of the real Hephaistíon. Iskandar's mother, Olympias, knew that her son would need both a confidant he could trust to always remain loyal, and a mage who would protect him from curses. The real Hephaistíon was the former, and this woman was the latter.

This woman was raised by Olympias to be not only a great mage, but Iskandar's magecraft body double, and so was never given a name of her own. This lack of a name allowed her to use magecraft to fully become Iskandar, drawing any and all curses aimed at him to herself instead.

In consequence of her many deceptive traps and the many times she acted as his proxy, stories about her were apparently mixed in with later tellings of Iskandar's legends.

Usually, when a Servant is summoned, they retain either no memories at all of their past summonings, or at best, little more than faint trace impressions of previous summonings. But for some reason, this woman remembers everything from her last summoning. This is also why she prefers to be called Faker.

He Too Is Iskandar (False): A
This skill rises from her service as Iskandar's body double, and allows her to imitate both his Noble Phantasm and his skills. While the imitated skills are all one rank lower than the originals, she's also able to transform their abilities.

Rapid Words of Divine: B
She is a powerful mage from the Age of Gods, and is able to cast powerful, complex spells with only a single phrase.

Nameless's Blessing: EX
A skill unique to her, since she truly lacks a name. Enables her to draw damage directed at those she's accepted as her Master towards herself, whether it from be sword, spell, or curse. As long as she has time to plan ahead, she can also greatly reduce the damage before it reaches her.

『Hecatic Wheel』
Rank: C+~A+
NP Type: Anti-Army
Range: 2 - 100
Maximum Targets: 100

Wheel of the Demonic Heavens
While she lived, Iskandar himself entrusted her with his Noble Phantasm, the Wheel of Divine Majesty. But rather than having a Divine Beast pull it, it's said she summoned a dragon made entirely from bones. While this Noble Phantasm is lower ranked compared to both the original Wheel of Divine Majesty and the Distant Bucephalus it uses, she can also use magecraft to help it turn precisely and even steer itself. She can further infuse it with her Master's magical energy to boost its rank for a brief time.

Trace remnants of Mnemosyne, the Autonomic Observational Existence Verification System developed by Chaldea some time ago, are mixed into her Spirit Origin. While these remnants make up only a tiny percentage of her overall being, they are sufficient to place her in the Pretender class and to alter some of her stats and skills.

Territory Creation: EX
A skill inherited from Mnemosyne. As an Autonomic Observational Existence Verification System, she is essentially an entire workshop unto herself. Thanks to the remnants of Mnemosyne, she can replicate the full functionality of a workshop within herself.

Oblivion Negation: EX
A skill that seems superficially similar to Oblivion Correction. It is, however, anything but. Thanks to the system named after Mnemosyne, the Greek god of memory, whenever this woman is summoned via Chaldea's summoning system, she can perfectly recall almost detail of her previous summonings.

When did she get here...? A pretty, flowery mage who's there, smiling a gentle smile before you even notice her.

Who could she be...?

Height/Weight: 156cm, 20kg
Origin: Legend of King Arthur, etc.
Region: Western Europe
Alignment: Chaotic-Good
Sub-Attribute: Earth
Gender: Female
It's hard to tell if she gets along well with Fou, or if they actually can't stand each other. All we can say for sure is that they're frequently seen together.

She reminds me of someone. She reeeally reminds me of someone. It may have been Master who said that, or Technical Advisor Da Vinci, or Director Goredolf. Maybe she's related to you-know-who somehow? Yeah, you know. The Mage of Flowers, Mer—

"That's right! Of course I remind you of Merlin. I'm his little sister, after all."

Oh, okay! That makes sense!

A pretty flower of a woman who never loses her composure. Her beauty often makes those who meet her feel as though they're in a dream, and leaves some men with the impression that she may even be an enchantress sent to entice them to their doom.

She views the world objectively, as though she's always aware of the bigger picture, a step removed from normal perspectives. Some people interpret this dryness as serene wisdom, while others see it as typical for a coldhearted mage.

As a Mage of Flowers, she understands that the human world is a cruel and ugly place, but also has a soft spot for it, believing that it's basically okay "as long as they have a single star that still shines bright."

Light Be in Your Hands: B
A blessing given to those who struggle with something so powerful they can scarcely imagine it. This blessing, however, is meant to help them on their quest to claim what they desire, rather than simply giving it to them outright.
(In fact, this is actually a variant of Hero Creation.)

Flower Blooming on a Summer's Night: D
Charisma which people of all types naturally gravitate towards. This tends to draw people towards her until she finds herself the center of attention. However, as she loves fun and novel things, and tends to wander around freely on her own rather than put down roots in any one place, she is rarely able to make full use of this skill.
(In fact, this is actually a variant of Dreamlike Charisma.)

『Winds of Avalon』
Rank: A
NP Type: Anti-Personnel
Range: 1 - 100
Maximum Targets: –

Utopia That Beckons Beyond.
Avalon will continue to exist for as long as humankind does, and Lady Avalon sees it as the ideal future humankind hopes to reach one day. That is why the Avalon in which she lives is not shut away from the outside world, but instead positioned as a goal she has set for humanity to strive towards. The staff she wields points to a place just over the horizon. It is a guiding light, and the very hope that still drives people ever forward. That is why she continues to point the way: so those who continue to advance will not falter, in hope that one day, their journey may finally come to an end.

Once this Noble Phantasm's True Name is released, all nearby can see a far-off utopia that lies in a phantasmal world. They can feel a warm, pleasant spring breeze filled with the scent of flowers—a breeze that feels as though it can melt even the coldest of frozen, desolate seas. It fills those who dream of utopia with the sense that such a thing truly could become reality.

She will never reveal her true identity.

Why does she desperately flee the King Arthur who claims to be from another world? Even if what she says about having come here from paradise is true, there's no way she can actually be Merlin's sister. Even if you ask her directly, she'll only smile gently in response.

Maybe...it's not actually possible for her to answer this question herself? Maybe if she did, she'd dissolve into foam and disappear?

...Who am I?
...What's my True Name?

The most likely reason she was made a Pretender is that she won't answer those questions, no matter what. At any rate, as has been stated, she refuses to give her name. Instead, she simply stands there smiling like a flower (you know, if flowers could smile), watching over the Master of Chaldea's journey.

　　　◆

It's actually still not clear how Lady Avalon wound up in the Arctic Circle Singularity. Sometimes, she says that the Holy Grail called her there. Other times, she says that she came of her own accord. If she really is connected to Merlin somehow, it's entirely possible that she came simply because she wanted to. Though of course, we'll never get the truth out of her either way...

Stars in the sky, and scoundrels upon the earth. Who is Elisa the Nine-Tattooed Dragon, you ask!? A Servant born of a devilish idea: a mashup of Shi Jin the Nine-Tattooed Dragon and Elisabeth Báthory!

Class? Pretender!

Height/Weight: 127cm, 29kg
Source: Halloween Rebellion of 108!, "Water Margin"
Region: Hungary, China
Alignment: Chaotic-Evil
Sub-Attribute: Human
Gender: Female
There's a subtle difference between them: Shi Jin uses the complicated Chinese word for dragon, while Elisa is the more simplified version.
"Feels like this is gonna cause a lot of typos!"

A mysterious shadow suddenly appeared in Csejte Castle.
Elisabeth fought alongside the summoned Shi Jin, but they were handed a sound defeat after their enemy promptly acquired the Holy Grail.
Still, when life gives her lemons, Elly knows to make lemonade. She fused with Shi Jin.

And behold! Like a phoenix from the ashes, they're back as Elisa the Nine-Tattooed Dragon of Mount Liang, formerly known as Csejte Castle!!!
She's the only one who can make such wonders possible, so good children and Servants would do well not to follow her example.

Independent Action: B+
Elisa the Nine-Tattooed Dragon is like a cloud.

Territory Creation (Mount Liang): EX
Elisa the Nine-Tattooed Dragon can form Mount Liang, a fearsome power normally reserved for Song Jiang and Chao Gai.
She has acquired this skill thanks to the influence of her second Noble Phantasm.
She cannot create anything other than Mount Liang.

War Cry, Mount Liang: EX
A special-grade skill to assemble the gallant outlaws of Mount Liang.
"I'll gather the feelings of everyone from Mount Liang!"

"I want to do something for all the suffering people." "I want to drink wine." "I want to murder." "I want to hold a feast." "I'm hungry for meat." "I want to swipe something." "I want to fire a cannon."

"They're mostly degenerates, huh!"
Actually, her abilities change through the strange interactions with her comrades summoned by her second Noble Phantasm.

Grand Banquet, Mount Liang: EX
An extravagant banquet hosted by all of Mount Liang's outlaws. They run amok all day, spreading their noisy, joyous chaos.
The effect of this skill could be described as a variant or reversal of Golden Rule. Once active, those in its area spend great sums of money on food, drink, and pleasure.
Elisabeth's loneliness may have given rise to this skill.

Minute Star of Heaven's Raiment: C
The central skill of Elisabeth Báthory, now Elisa the Nine-Tattooed Dragon. Cloaked in the might of the Minute Star of Heaven, she is simultaneously Elisabeth while bearing the power of Shi Jin, the Nine-Tattooed Dragon.

She's become younger because Elisabeth Báthory's Spirit Origin was imbued with the Minute Star's powers before stabilizing. Her state could be described as Elly pretending to be Shi Jin.

『Jiulong Eli-chan, Shooting Star!』
Rank: A-
NP Type: Anti-Song Dynasty
Range: 1 - 10
Maximum Targets: 30

Nine Great Azure Dragon Princesses, Shooting Star Heavens!
For some reason, the name for this is a mess!

"It's nine attacks at the same time! Just like that Multi-Dimensional Refraction thingy!"

...So Eli-chan says, but what actually happens is that her companions from Mount Liang deliver the other eight attacks, beating the targets up black and blue. (They are strengthened according to the number of allies gathered by her second Noble Phantasm.)
In effect, she summons the generations of Elisabeths to represent her power.

Since this Noble Phantasm takes on the appearance of shooting stars, its power is halved while indoors, funny enough.

That said, being nine consecutive attacks delivered by Servants, it's still quite powerful.

　　◆

『Gather Round, Everyone! This is Our Water Margin!』
Rank: EX
NP Type: Anti-Song Dynasty
Range: 1
Maximum Targets: 108

Mount Liang Reassembled: Calling All Gallant Outlaws!
The Noble Phantasm that caused a Halloween event.
It gathers one hundred and eight Servants to form Mount Liang.
The Servants are easily summoned, but this can only be activated near Csejte Castle and Elisa the Nine-Tattooed Dragon, so there are no exceptional ways to use it.
The alternative would be a terrifying prospect, indeed.

But Eli-chan has faith—faith that you'll be kind enough to answer her call.

This year's Elly is a bumper crop, too!
Call it a once-in-a-decade Elisabethean boom.

...And so came Elisa the Nine-Tattooed Dragon.
Building upon the flawless, self-centered foundation of regular Elisabeth with the naive, friendly charm of a normal girl, we now miraculously have a seventh Elisabeth.
(The two mechs count as one.)
As for her occasional streak of cruelty, it is unknown whether this is the influence of Elisabeth or Shi Jin the Nine-Tattooed Dragon.

Unlike the Elisabeths of the past, however, this one has no interest in being a pop star. She does enjoy singing, but not in the way that idols do.

Having merely fought alongside Shi Jin, their temporary alliance is neither overly warm nor disagreeable. She merely combined her powers with his to face a greater foe.
Shi Jin transformed into a nine-section staff. The weapon is self-aware, and it talks.

Appears in "Halloween Rebellion of 108!"
Elisabeth's diversity (diversity?) has given rise to yet another kindred (kindred?).

Shi Jin the Nine-Tattooed Dragon was a famed hero in "Water Margin," and his power allows a Servant to fight even if she appears to be a powerless young girl. 
That is what makes Elisabeth a Pretender.

She loves the old members of Mount Liang. She loves the current members, too.
Keep this a secret, but she hates being alone.
Being enemies with Huyan Zhuo came as a great shock to her.

Quick to laugh, quick to cry, quick to rage, and quick to sleep, this is Elisabeth before she was taught to be a noblewoman. 
Or perhaps...this is how she might have turned out if she was never raised by nobility. 
One can only speculate as to which is the case, since no actual example exists.

She needs to gather 108 heroes, but once she does, the fun days at Mount Liang will end.
Coming to terms with this fact, Elisa the Nine-Tattooed Dragon has resolved to rebuild Mount Liang once more within Chaldea.
And that illustrious band of heroes shall be joined by yet another...

Spirit Origin for Noble Phantasm Enhancement.
Can only be used as an NP Enhancement material to raise the NP level of the target Servant.

A mysterious Servant who goes by the names Tlāloc and Huītzilōpōchtli. Aztec mythology describes Tlāloc as the god of rain and ruler of the world during its third genesis. It also tells of his destruction by a rain of fire. Huītzilōpōchtli is an Aztec tribal deity, revered as a god of war and avatar of the sun.

Height/Weight: 168cm, 55kg
Origin: Aztec civilization, Mesoamerican mythology
Region: Mesoamerica
Alignment: Lawful-Good
Sub-Attribute: Earth
Gender: Female
"Cities which revere the gods must be strong and beautiful. Please never suggest in my presence that a city is merely a place to live."

Personality
Introverted and active. An iron-willed overachiever who believes in her own righteousness and fervently adheres to it. Her idea of justice is a city's prosperity and safety, while her notion of evil is a city's decline and lack of safety. She does neither praises nor smiles on those who live righteous lives, but welcomes them warmly. She neither scolds nor scorns those who live evil lives, but executes them outright.

"I do not question the nature or value of war. I will accept combat for any reason. But it means to fight and die means everything," declared Tezcatlipoca. Although they do not see eye to eye, she tolerates this sentiment because of her respect and affection for him.

She rates herself as a cold and ruthless beauty, but her mannerisms tend to reveal how she feels in the moment. Take her sighs of deep affection and obsession, her sighs of disappointment and pity, or her sighs of hostility and rage. While they seem similar on the surface, the manner in which she delivers them varies greatly in tone and meaning.

Much like the rain which falls under her divine portfolio, she can be quite clingy.

condMessage: Unlocked after completing a certain quest in Lostbelt No.7 and reaching Bond Level 3.
comment:
This Servant in the form of a young woman calls Tezcatlipoca her older brother and claims to be Tlāloc, the god of rain, as well as Huītzilōpōchtli, the god of war. Her true identity is that of an Elemental inhabiting a city—a city which has been anthropomorphized as a Servant. Namely, Tenochtitlan, the capital of the Aztec Empire from the 14th to 16th centuries. Tenochtitlan was a watery city which was home to some 300,000 souls, populated only by its king, priests, nobles, merchants, and slaves. Lacking even a single farmer, it was the latest and greatest model city of its time.

It is said that when the conquistador Hernán Cortés and his expedition visited Tenochititlan, they were in awe of this city, the likes of which existed nowhere else in the world. All traces of its glory are now lost, buried beneath Mexico City, the capital of Mexico.

condMessage: Unlocked after completing a certain quest in Lostbelt No.7 and reaching Bond Level 4.
comment:
Territory Creation: EX
Tenochtitlan, an anthropomorphized city, possesses Territory Creation of the highest rank.

Divinity: A+
This skill's rank is very high because she possesses two Divinities at once.

Waterside Livelihood: A+
The pride and dignity of the greatest city of water. 

City-State Alliance: A
The Aztec Empire was made up of three confederated city-states: Tenochtitlan, Tetzcoco, and Tlacopan.

Third Sun: A
Creates the world ruled by the rain god Tlāloc: Nahui Quiahuitl, the Third Sun.

Xōchiyāōyōtl: A
Known as "Flower War." Flower wars were tribal conflicts that sustained the city-states and served as necessary sources of slave labor. It is said that the vital energy of the blood that flowed from hearts sacrificed upon Tenochtitlan's altars preserved the world (sun).

Lake of the Moon: EX
Metzliapan. When the nomadic Aztec people arrived at a land of respite, they built the city later known as Tenochtitlan upon this lake. It is a convergence point of the human order, bringing about humanity's rest and prosperity. It is essentially a place of power. While it exists on the planet's surface, it has the same leylines as the Inner Sea of the Planet.

Grants significant physical damage reduction to the entire party and a massive power-up to Tenochtitlan herself.

condMessage: Unlocked after completing a certain quest in Lostbelt No.7 and reaching Bond Level 5.
comment:
『Ometeotl Tenochtitlan』
Rank: D
NP Type: Anti-army
Range: 1–40

Dual Activated Heart City.
Tenochtitlan, city of water, is no mere city. Its skeleton is the soul of the tribal god Huītzilōpōchtli. Its skin is the soul of Tlāloc, god of rain and droughts. Its muscles are great heaps of stone. And the blood spilled from sacrifices is the pipeline to activate this gigantic mobile weapon!

All this means it is a thirty to fifty-meter high city-pattern giant robot. (There is a cockpit, and Tenochtitlan is within.) The city rises, takes on a form somewhat resembling Tenochtitlan herself, and morphs two temples enshrining their respective gods into weapons not unlike lances. The chest contains the precious stored blood of all the sacrifices that bled in Tenochtitlan, used as a magical energy power source to fire an ultra-high heat ray.

condMessage: Unlocked after completing Lostbelt No.7 and reaching Bond Level 5.
comment:
Because Tenochtitlan is the soul of a city, she likes humans in general. It's unclear whether she's affectionate towards the human mammals themselves, or whether she just appreciates them as further ornamentation to brighten the city itself. The answer is probably a combination of both sentiments.

She casually invites anyone she's fond of to live within her in a manner that can only be described as salacious.

"I've looked into your current home. There's nothing wrong with it per se, but if you live in a town like that, your life is bound to slide downhill. You should move."

　　◆

She's a cool beauty who is prone to ennui, but remains impulsive and unbothered, living life at her own pace. When she loses her temper, the abuse she hurls at those around her doesn't help her overachiever image at all. And it happens rather often.

Her inner nature stems from her resentment at being a fallen city. Moctezuma II's choices led to the doom of the Aztec Empire and Tenochtitlan vanishing from the earth. She desires neither the revival of the Aztecs nor the restoration of Tenochtitlan. But if she could be a city, one last time...

Her earnest wish is to protect the lives of her residents, no matter how tiny a world she's in.

From selfish, capricious, cruel, and just the worst...to serious, mean, selective, and savage♡

Any rebellious peasants will be turned into stickers. But she also turns obedient peasants into stickers just for fun. Now, this overwhelming mass of fluff shakes up the tropics. Who could the mysterious Miko, shrine maiden in service to the enshrined deity, possibly be?

Height/Weight: 170cm, 54kg
Origin: It's a mystery!
Region: It's a mystery!
Alignment: Chaotic-Evil
Sub-Attribute: Earth
Gender: Female
"Hey! I told you it's a secret! If you tell Mother, I. Will. Murder. You!"

Personality
Introverted and passive. She used to be extroverted and active, but that personality was more of a mask meant to help her defend herself, as Morgan told her to be vicious.

But because she was freed both mentally and physically at the tropical resort, she acts more in line with her original personality of keeping to herself despite her cleverness. She is also indifferent to notions of good and evil, though she will respond swiftly to an attack on anything she likes.

Then again, her characterization as Tam Lin Tristan that she accumulated for nearly one hundred years has not changed. In stark contrast to everything above, her tendency to mock those she sees as weaker than herself remains. Therefore, her domineering tendency of mercilessly pushing others around to satisfy her own desires still runs rampant. Her previous self would be mortally by the sight of good deeds and hypocrisy, leading to some of the worst of her abuse. Her justification for her actions was that she was bored out of her mind.

But now, as the maiden of the enshrined deity, her sadistic nature tends to be roused whenever she sees the weak trying their very hardest, and so she can't resist abusing them. She justifies this by saying they are more cute for experiencing her torment.

Riding Skill: EX
Baobhan Sith never had a chance to ride anything before, but now that she has become the priestess of the enshrined deity, she has gained an incredible Riding Skill. The sight of her sitting atop the enshrined deity’s head and looking down on her enemies from her high seat definitely makes her look like an evil princess.

Territory Creation: D
As it happens, she’s not really good at building workshops. All the workshop building skills she once had, she learned from Morgan. This is what happens when she is out, away from Morgan.

Tam Lin: E
By becoming the maiden of the enshrined deity, her Tam Lin rank has decreased. This was inevitable since she has become a shrine maiden, but she does feel bad about her downgraded rank. (She feels remorseful towards Morgan). Should anyone bring this up, she tends to fly off the handle. If someone teases her about it, she generally just starts sobbing, claiming there's nothing she can do about it. Just...try not to bully MikoCer, okay?

In her Third Ascension, she transforms into a Tam Lin, so only then does this skill’s rank rise to A.

Maiden of the Enshrined Deity: A
The voice of the enshrined deity. Party members of either Chaotic or Good alignments receive a blessing from the protection of the enshrined deity. Only in her Third Ascension form does this skill’s rank drop to B.

Mikonos☆MikoCer: EX
A magic word of the MikoCer, who is both the maiden of the enshrined deity and a magical girl. It means "any wish can come true," or "everything will go your way." Bystanders will simply think she is a small Grail that can grant any wish.

...But the magic word actually keeps going, concluding with "...if you work hard enough☆"

Successor of the Land of Rain: EX
There was once a witch in the library said to be from Orkney. As Baobhan Sith got really into reading books, she just happened to fit that lifestyle as well.

Mikonos Hammer: B
Even the gentle enshrined deity can get mad when the occasion calls for it. Actually, because it hardly ever gets mad, the maiden tends to get VERY mad on its behalf! This retaliatory magecraft converts the pain the shrine deity experiences into destructive power, then releases it. Typically it's just an NP Buff and Critical Star generator, but if she sustains even one attack during the previous turn, her NP Strength increases radically.

『Easter Failnaught』
Rank: A
NP Type: Anti-World
Range: 0 - 50
Maximum Targets: 50

Celebration Dance of Blessings.
This resurrection festival summons Proper Human History's shrine deity, which slumbered in a secluded forest as civilization advanced. The maiden sits atop the enshrined deity's head and reveals the deity's power to those who dwell on Earth.

As awe-inspiring as that would have been, this is actually just a tag-team move, as Baobhan Sith stands atop the enshrined deity's head and happily hurls insults in all directions while the deity unleashes magical energy in response. Her words and destructive power are truly terrifying, but Baobhan Sith claims (with a straight face, no less) that she is only giving “a setting for the people to offer their gratitude for the achievements and blessings of the enshrined deity." That's the claim, anyway.

This Noble Phantasm consists of powerful attacks, Curse, Poison, and a reduction in ATK power for all enemies. All the status ailments disappear at the end of the turn, though. Baobhan Sith's, "Damn insignificants, die♡" insults cause the target's sense of reason to froth with anger the moment they hear it, but since it's kind of weak as insults go, that anger pretty much instantly goes away.

A member of Faerie Britain's Knights of the Round Table. This Tam Lin's Spirit Origin was dubbed Tristan, after the Round Table knight from Proper Human History. She receives favorable treatment as the "daughter" and successor of High Queen Morgan, who rules over Lostbelt Britain. Prior to being adopted as Morgan's daughter, she was a vampiric faerie. Tristan is one of only two faeries raised as a witch, since magecraft was not necessary in Faerie Britain. (If you're wondering, the other was Altria Caster.)

In consequence of this personal history, Baobhan Sith changed slightly upon her summoning as a Servant.

Morgan, her beloved mother and monarch, announced that they would be spending their summer vacation at a resort. She did not elaborate further.

"The tropics? Going out and sightseeing with other Servants sounds so ludicrous. Then again, I guess it'll be okay as long as I can spend time with Mother! Pushing around the small fry (*Master) having their fun at the resort might be fun too!" 

And so Baobhan Sith, her hopes high, made her way to the tropics. However, the day after her arrival, Baobhan Sith was drawn in by a mysterious voice, deep in the forest. There, she discovered the enshrined deity, pent up with its grudge and nowhere to go.

"My tummy kinda hurts-nos."

Seeing that she couldn't leave the enshrined deity to suffer, Baobhan Sith changed her class to miko, or the maiden of the enshrined deity, to regain its Authority. As she became the maiden of the enshrined deity, Baobhan Sith also changed her name to "Cait Cú MikoCer." (The first part of the name means cat and dog fae, respectively, which are fae from the Scottish Highlands, just like Baobhan Sith. The MikoCer part she came up with on her own.) And so she became a mysterious magical girl set to sabotage the ServantFes and stand in Chaldea's way.

　　　◆

First Ascension
The maiden of the enshrined deity. The bad guy set to sabotage ServantFes and the boss of the event's opening act. However she wisely came to the conclusion that her methods were not going to be effective, and so began to work on other methods that did not rely on violence.

Second Ascension
Her appearance as the "witch in the house." Basically her off-duty persona. Altria Caster and Master found her looking like this when they visited the witch in the house to try to make peace with MikoCer. After a lengthy discussion, it was revealed that MikoCer was a pseudonym, and her Ture Name was Baobhan Sith.

This came as a surprise to no one at all.

Third Ascension
The Tam Lin form she willingly assumed. In the past, Baobhan Sith had no choice but to fight as a Tam Lin. This time, she chose to take this form for the enshrined deity's sake, for ServantFes, and above all, for herself. The pure white bandages wrapped around her are no longer stained with blood as they were before, and she has become an anti-curse faerie set to defeat the Calamity of the Curse.

One of the horns of the sixth Beast, who was defeated by another Chaldea in a parallel world. A creature born of depravity. It is said to appear and devour the wickedness of cities that have prospered, reached their apex, and fallen to corruption. Its name: Sodom's Beast. It is the Beast said to have destroyed Babylon in the New Testament.

Height/Weight:
When in heliocentric theory form: 135cm, 100kg (Main body is 35kg, while her tail weighs 65kg)
When in geocentric theory form: Voluptuous.
Origin: New Testament, Fate/Grand Order
Region: Middle East
Alignment: Chaotic-Evil
Sub-Attribute: Beast
Gender: Female
When she was in her full Beast VI mode, she was a truly massive adult female but she has now accepted that she was once defeated and so, admirably, she maintains a very normal Spirit Origin matching humanity's standards.

Beast VI/S
A certain Roman emperor who was regarded as “the Beast of 666” and “the enemy of God” that had transformed into a disaster...according to legend. The emperor's hypothetical form, had she not accepted her fate of dying alone after three resurrections.

Personality (heliocentric theory form):
A ruthless queen. Forever in a bad mood. She may be tyrannical but she would never upend order or break contracts thanks to her innate earnest personality. In her impeccable state, there will be times she smiles with satisfaction as she enjoys witnessing man's depravity but the juvenile Sodom's Beast takes no satisfaction in witnessing the same thing. 

While she is a young Beast VI that constantly spreads depravity, she detests corruption, laziness, and wastefulness. (Because she hates futile resistance, she doesn't much like fighting either.) She perceives passion as her enemy. (Note that she is only hostile to it; she does not hate it.)

Though she may not show it outwardly, deep down she seems to long for a human who can overcome temptation and become a small but reliable beacon of light for her.

"In the universe in its proper state, the beast of the apocalypse shall submit to the earth, while the rose slumbers without rising to the heavens and blooms throughout the land."

Authority of Beasts: C
Also called an "anti-humanity" skill. Reduces damage from anything that has any connections with humans, regardless of whether the target is a Heroic Spirit or even a god.

Independent Manifestation: E
A skill that allows one to manifest in the world without outside help. This Beast seems to be capricious, since she is satisfied with the destruction of a single city. This skill is also already exists in every space-time possible, so not only can the skill nullify any paradoxes resulting from time travel, but it can also nullify various Death-related attacks.

Nega-Messiah: EX
Nullifies all protections from faith. Additionally, this skill has a hidden ability that applies advantageous attributes against special classes bearing names of saviors and weakens their specialized skills.

『Babalon Domus Aurea』
Rank: A
NP Type: Anti-Army
Range: 1 - 30
Maximum Targets: 7

Embrace of the Golden Theater.
After imprisoning the target within the golden theater, the entire theater is destroyed. While Emperor Nero invited people in to try to welcome them into the embrace of pleasure, Draco confines people and attempts to save them through despair.

Number of the Beast: C
A degraded version of the unique skill possessed by Beast VI. 666, the number of the Beast, is engraved upon her.

Seven Beast Crowns: C
The horns representing the beast of the apocalypse, the blasphemer, and destroyer of cities.

Aurea Poculum: C
A sacred chalice of depravity that endlessly pours forth all manner of human desires, including greed, lust, and gluttony.

Personality (Geocentric theory form):
Refer to her Heliocentric theory form, which comprises her First and Second Ascensions, for her basic personality. In her Third Ascension, she makes a connection with Master after something was proven to her, and a new Draco is born. Ultimately, her essential nature as the Rose Emperor comes to the fore, influencing her personality.

In this form, she is notably less grumpy, giving her positive, passionate side more of an opportunity to show itself. She affirms humanity's greed, tolerates waste and opulence, and praises Master's struggles. She recognizes Master as a suitable partner, worthy of commanding a Beast like herself, and she will not hesitate to use all her strength for her Master. However, because her personality leans heavily towards her original self, she gets moody if she is not frequently doted on. It's kind of a pain when she gets to pouting though, as she's not honest about her feelings.

She is arrogant yet devoted, ruthless yet loving, high strung yet lonely. Yes, she may be a Beast who devours the human world but she makes an effort to walk alongside humans. Though she is an Evil of Humanity, she still loves humanity.

"In the universe in its proper state, the beast of the apocalypse leaves Earth, while the rose blazes across the universe as it goes up in flames, becoming a dazzling star."


Behavior Towards Master:
This is the Draco who has formed a bond of trust with Master. Unlike her First and Second Ascension forms, Draco in her Third Ascension demonstrates excessive and overt infatuation with Master. The original Draco is embarrassed by her Third Ascension self and insists, "That is not me," or "Forget about her. I will do the same."

condMessage: Unlock by completing "Final Singularity" and Bond Level 5
comment:
In a certain parallel world, Sodom's Beast imitated Goetia's Incineration Humanity to create a Proof World and summoned many versions of Chaldea from numerous parallel worlds. By collecting these Chaldeas' many desires, Sodom's Beast attained its true form. However, it was then defeated by a certain Chaldea and the Proof World collapsed. To put an end to all of this herself, she summoned Servants who could defeat a Beast. This is where the tale of Beast VI should have ended.

And yet, the destroyed Proof World came into contact with what is said to be the original Chaldea. The Incarnadine Demonic Beasts who refused to die out abducted Master, bringing them to the Proof World. And thus, a new tale of Draco and Master in the Spiral Proof World began.

Draco, having overcome her original fated demise, is a hypothetical version, quite different from the her that was supposed to have been expelled in Proper Human History...and so her route leading the world into a cursed end continues. 
All of this is why Draco was summoned as a Beast.
What does that mean?
What end awaits?
The answers lie within the tragedies and comedies spun from romance.

Prayers and curses...scars and love...right and wrong...
Everything shall be engulfed, rising up to the heavens.

The legend speaks.
Kings are noble, holy, and unreachable.
As a promising and fulfilling tomorrow awaits.
The stars speak.
Eras will change, rules will change.
The age of kingship will one day come to an end.

The crown shines brightly atop one accepting of the truth.
Even if one shall never be rewarded, and even if the ideal shall never be realized.

Inexperienced, unskilled, and ordinary.
There was a time where the boy only knew uncertainty.
But there was a king who scolded him, who laughed with him.
With loneliness, regret, and a little sense of pride, the boy continues to chase after this king.

I am not afraid of anyone. 
Except that devil, Dracul. 

It is not of hatred, nor of enjoyment. 
Because it is necessary, to strike fear into thy enemy. 
Lord Impaler shall continue to trample over the enemy.

She heard the voice of the Lord.
The voice was serene yet full of sorrow, and it told her to save the people.
The maiden, dreaming of beautiful tomorrows, chose to stand up and fight.
For her village, for her nation, and for the Lord.

Goodbye, Jeanne d'Arc of Domremy.
The happiness she once dreamed of, still hangs high over the skies of your home.

Her heart is forged from the concept of dragons.

Its magical energy can rival that of Earth's own core.
Pulsing with the dragon's roar, the king shall bring down the Sword of the Planet.

The Sacred Sword is crowned the strongest, because of the power of its wielder.

A soldier is running through the crossfire.
The Guardian takes out his targets, precisely, swiftly, and mercilessly.

He cannot abandon the mission he was tasked, nor can he save the many lives he wished to.

But the ambition consumes him like fire, as he keeps resisting the unavoidable fate.

...Temporary resting place of the sword.

The girl is gentle yet proud.
And this is her memory of one winter.
According to the prophet, everything is sacred, in creation, in woods, and in oaks.

Oh, I love you, I love you, I love you!
I loved you from the bottom of my heart.
If this feeling of mine is not real, then nothing else in this world is real.
That's why ... I burned them with love and sorrow.
I just burned them.

Everytime someone holds me, I get something pretty.
Everytime someone kisses me, I get something expensive.
I need these to survive, but they are of no worth to me, yet they just keep on piling on each other.

And then this time, what I really need is becoming farther and farther away from me.

In the prison of darkness, there's only eternal solitude.
She can't perceive it, not entirely.
A vague premonition is stirring up Altera's heart.

A gift from the Queen of White Lily to Chevalier d'Eon. 

"Let me give you something you really should be wearing, oh my wonderful knight."

Nature gave her three talents.
One, an abnormal sense for music.
Two, a having dragon's gene hidden within her.
And three, the dignity befitting of a noble and ruler.
In other words, she understands the knowledge that's fundamental to a nation.

This elixir is the result of her talents, a remedy that claims to cure all illnesses.
But its real identity is...

"There's some history behind this necklace, sure I got into some trouble with this necklace... but still, I like this necklace. Because, it is so sparkly and pretty." 

(Marie Antoinette, when she talked about it in Chaldea)

...and then. 
This is in her possession as a saint. 
Even if she held a staff in life, it was not in this shape. What was in her mind? When she saw the cross on her staff, which symbolizes "He."

An iron coffin that sucks away much blood, and steals away many lives.
Many maidens' lives have faded away in mists, leaving behind only despairs and sorrows.
Truly, this is the work of a devil. But her true sin was that she remained.

The scream fades.
The nails under the skin get rusted.
The blood dries into stains.
The iron coffin, chained with its master, is fading away in the isolation.

A cat thinks, therefore a cat is.

What is a meal?
Is it one to make themselves? Or to be made by others?
To give to oneself? Or to be given to others?
No cat has reached this truth yet.
Only the one who mastered the culinary arts gets to wear this pink robe.
The Cat Mage Merlin says, "Whoever wears this apron will make an ideal wife, and will also be able to govern Chaldea."

...I thought about a story. What do you think?

The unpromised sword of victory. 
Despite having the name "victory," Queen Boudica's life ended in defeat. 
Even so, she stood against all sorts of tyranny with courage, and her path of reaching victory, has left an eternal impression in people's heart.

Let me tell you a story.

Ever since his own birth, the man has always been unsatisfied.
Pain, itchiness, dullness, swelling.
His body was filled with these feelings all over like a lice infection.
He believed in words instead of intuitions, and stories over emotions.
Therefore, the man was not at peace with himself.
It doesn't matter if it's the grievance of the oppressed, or if it's the joy of the unworthy neighbors.
Everything seems to be full of unbearable discontentment.
The man said, "I'm like a cat swarmed by lice."
All of my worries, you laughed them off as if they were simply something insignificant.

This was what happened on one sunny, yet very ordinary day.

Across the sky of morning light, lights of seven colors can be seen...

"Seven colored lights?
I thought it was only one light when I fired it. Yet again, I never get to see the end."

"I guess ... the lights were seven colors."

In the Age of Gods, where man's domain was still limited, a king gathered all the treasure across all the lands and stored them inside a vault he had built.

Those were known as the origins of all treasures that followed.
The evidence of all mankind's wisdom and knowledge.
People started to praise it as the "Gate of the Gods."
Truly, it is.
Eventually, the "vault" itself became a Mystic more mysterious than the treasures it held.

Also, the key to the vault can only be used by the King.
The key will constantly change its shape, and the vault will constantly store new treasures.
Without the wisdom to instantly understand those Mystics, the key will never be able to open the vault's gate.

"What? What's the story with these sunglasses?
No big story here. These are just ordinary sunglasses.
But, from all the sunglasses I've seen,
these gotta be the most GOLDEN sunglasses!
I mean, its got UV protections!
To be honest, it's easier to go full spark on the enemies with these on. Or else, it's a little bit too bright, y'know?"
(Sakata Kintoki, at Chaldea)

"O heaven, let ye construct, and show thy supreme light."

The name of the theatre is Domus Aurea.
It's an imaginary heaven decorated with a crimson awning and gold.
But, it is more than something beautiful.
Glorious days, cruel betrayals, merciless misunderstandings, and even unrealized blessings.
She loved them all, and praised their beauty.

The applause wasn't for the heroine on the stage, but for the life of everyone who was there.

The family of mist told the hero at his death, "The treasure was cursed."
They were right about that.
Everything went wrong.
Nobody could stop it.

The hero has no attachment to the gold
but he couldn't throw it away because it was obvious that it would start shining as soon as it is thrown. On that day, the curse came true.

Servant? Hero?
I'm surprised that I became such a thing.
It's a strange feeling.
All sorts of things are taking shape.

...You don't get it?
Gaze upon my hand.

This is my radiance, the glow of a goddess materializing.
Don't look for too long, else you'll be blinded.

Quietly the ship sailed out in the morning glow.

This is one of the ends she saw at the ground of Selection.
With this trip, she made peace with the empire.
With this trip, she saw the burning coast of her hometown.

The history built upon Humanity's foundation is strong, therefore it will not accept any changes.

A girl's trip pursuing her ideal kingship will end soon. 
At the end of this journey, may hopes different than "her" be bestowed upon this girl.

Yes, this Ark was a covenant with God. 
It showed what must not be seen, and what must not be done.

Disaster to those who open it.
Despair to those who would reveal its contents.

For this is a sign of God's trust in humanity, His belief that we are not foolish enough to open what He has told us not to open.

The vault that holds all treasures on earth.
Also called the "Gate of the Gods."
The legendary treasure vault of Babylon itself.

At the grave of Assyrian Queen Nitocris, it is said there hides the door leading to such a vault.
Although the many Kings of Babylon would never touch it, a great king opened the door without hesitation.

Herodotus wrote, "There was nothing in the grave."
Didn't the king obtain a vast amount of wealth?
Or did the king bring prosperity upon his nation through politics alone?

At least the king's descendants were wealthy.
Therefore, many battles were waged upon such a notion.

Even after taking the throne and all the familicide, it wasn't enough blood for the cursed axe.

Made from a demonic beast and forged by a witch.
Various demonic elements devour the king.
"What about it?"
The king is aware of the curse, yet if the axe will help him demonstrate his authority as a king, then he has no regrets.

Let the feast of blood begin.

A somber moment begins.
The screams of the crowd. Their insults. Their cheers...
Ignore them and focus on your "comrade" before you.
A hungry lion bares its fangs.  
Its hunger has made it dangerous, and you hear it has already devoured three men.
Both he and you must kill or be killed.
That's why the beast's death was certain.
...How sad.
You tyrants who would toy with the lives of man and beast, your hour shall come.
For I, Spartacus, swear I shall deal you a fatal blow!

Behold. The most beautiful winter constellation, the one and only Orion.
The three shining stars on my waist become the Tri-Star Belt.
Sumiyoshi Sanshin, or you may also know them as Delta, Zeta, and Epsilon.
Well, indeed they are beautiful stars.
But there is something more beautiful than the stars.
What is that you say? Of course it's your eyes.
They shine with radiance, deeply, lovingly, like the Milky Way itself.
Speaking of which, say beautiful, do you have time later?
What? You do but you can't? What do you mean there's a scary-looking girl standing behind me?
Hahahaha, c'mon, you must be jok... (the note ends here)

She was lucky, but she's never seen the face of fortune.
As she gazed upon the horizon, the sun, the waves, the stars and the enemies, she realized that in her days deprived of joy and romance, she must make a decision.

"I think even Lady Luck herself wouldn't stay long like this.
Aye, something must be done to show our gratitude."

So, a golden wheel was added to the ship.
Like a beautiful flower blooming in the heart of the devil.
Until the day the ship reaches to the Cape of Hope.

"That's funny! Real funny! Pirates have terrible tastes, eh, Boss?!"
"Say, why don't you get inside this barrel?
You like them deep sea explorations, don't ya?"

There is no light in my path.
My mouth is opened like a crescent moon, and my gaze is that of a blood-hungry beast.

My trained skills won't fade, but my soul has been tainted, and my limbs have turned into weapons.

My friend, you shall not see my face, as this helmet remains the only proof of my knighthood.

The forbidden fruit of the Gods, causing men's rationality to fade, yet promises them immortality.

Any human being would stop, reach for the fruit, and try to eat it. This is a conditioned response, similar to how you will retract your hand when touching something hot, a response carved deeply into our body.

A long time ago, during a race, someone used this on me and I had stopped, losing control over myself. I really don't want to remember what happened after.

And that's precisely why I won't give this to you.
...because, you have no need of something like this.
Isn't that right?

When Elisabeth Báthory woke up, she realized her class had become Caster.

"What? Why? I don't know any spells... OMG!
But you often hear idols becoming (news)casters, don't you...
Intellectual idols who can read news scripts without stuttering and such.
...Yes! I can do this!"

Behind a brand-new witch coordinating her brand-new costume, the Holy Pumpkin Grail shines brightly.

"Beware, little lizard... Your hardship is just about to start..."

"For real?"

The Demon King who obliterated the strongest cavalry brigade in the Warring States period.
Her battle has changed so many concepts of "War," and brought revolution to the battlefield.
It takes time to reload, and the accuracy is questionable.
Guns will never be of value on the battlefield.
That was what everybody thought at the time.

"Then I just need to gather a whole bunch of them and fire away right?
...In waves."

And today, the Demon King has obtained another innovation.
By the way, although the name is confusing, it's a matchlock rifle modified by adding rifling to the barrel, and not a Gatling gun.

"What? There's something like that? I-I want it!"

What a wonderful sled...
What a beautiful horse...
That is what Santa thinks to herself the day after Christmas while being covered by the vibrant glow of sunrise.

"I can't wait for next year... 363 days of the year gone to waste... Humans are such sad creatures."

But she doesn't yet know, that tragedy is already drawing close.

Yes... Who said there was only one Santa?

Don't lose your heart.
Don't forget to care, protect, and love.

People would easily fall into sinful pleasures.
Do not hurt, mock, or degrade others.
Because that is only a manifestation of weakness.
Everyday, I stand in front of the mirror and caution myself.
Be righteous.
Even if the world is filled with so many evils.

Let's shoot, steal, eat, assault, and kill!
Have fun and live, have fun and die.
As we're drowned in joy, pleasure, and happiness, as we're screaming, begging for more, aye, let's struggle and die!
There's no need to mourn the dead and repent for our sins.
We're pirates, and we're destined for Davy Jones' Locker.
So what's there to worry?
Ahoy, let's set sail with our beloved ship, and get killed with a smile on our faces!

Cut ties to the ordinary world, praise desire as one living, aim for infinity as a swordsman.
I have long forgot my own age, and I have long lost my own image.

Training is my ordinary.
Tirelessly, continuously, endlessly.
Before my end, I walked out into the woods and took a breath.

...His blade has finally reached the hollow moon.

Tamamo's Club.
It's a dream manual to prepare dreaming wives to one day live in a dream house with a dreamy husband.
The manual includes many tips and how-tos that can turn anybody into an ideal wife.

"I see, I see. Only ask your husband to spoil you when he has free time, and if your husband looks sad, please spoil him instead.
Of course, I already know this. Tamamo totally gets this sort of thing♡"

It's another dreamy day, dreaming with a dreamy husband.
But apparently, this book doesn't write about how to get that dreamy husband.
Oh well.

I know, I am a dropout.
I am a dropout who couldn't fight with everyone to the very end.

But, the word of "Sincerity" is carved deeply into my heart.

That alone is not a lie, for that represents the truth about me.

It doesn't matter if you are a man or woman, the death of a pirate is brutal.
That's why they both fought to the bitter end.
They fired their guns, swung their cutlasses, screamed with all their might, bathed in their enemies' blood, just like two berserkers on the battlefield.
Those in command of them, those that called themselves pirates, did not fight as bravely as they did.
They enjoyed taking, but weren't prepared to be taken.
Those cowards hid on their ship, trembling, like a bunch of losers.
There were only two pirates on the ship of Calico Jack - Mary Read and Anne Bonny.

Do you want to know what the Land of Shadows is like?
Just as the name implies, it's a place where shadows consume everything.
A world of darkness and death without a single ray of light.
Isn't it ironic that Cú Chulainn came here?
Isn't he a child of the sun?

...There are seven walls in the Land of Shadows.
But these walls are not literal, they are symbols of the absolute rule in this land. Which is,

"The dead cannot come back to life."

People from the Land of Shadows cannot cross the wall to return to Earth.
At least, that should've been the case. Master, I am looking forward to the day where you save the world and send me back to where I belong.

I saw a shooting star when I was a boy.

It was fast and without hesitation.
Many friends witnessed this and were saddened by its ephemeral flash.
At that moment, a quiet assurance has struck my heart.

"My body will be like that star, burning away at a young age, and then disappear."

Next thing I knew I was smiling.
I had accepted the fact even as a young boy, that all great warriors are destined to perish like that star.

The staff bestowed by the Goddess Hecate, and the only thing that reminds me of my homeland.

No matter how good I am at magecraft, no matter how much knowledge I have over magecraft, my lost homeland will never come back.

And so, at least let me leave behind a trace of my legacy.
Oh Goddess Hecate, may your blessing be upon my one and only beloved disciple, and let them enjoy those harsh yet fulfilling days, as I did with my dear sister-in-training.

After suffering persecution, the three sisters escaped to this island.

On the tiny island there was only the ruins of a temple and the sound of crashing waves.
There was no bountiful forest, loving animals, or flourid offerings.

Yet, their lives were filled with tranquility.
As long as the sisters could live a peaceful life together, and as long as the youngest could live for the sake of her two older sisters, there was no greater blessing.

Even if it was a dream that shall be lost one day.

I met a wise man after my first battle.
He preferred the lifestyle of a dog, and mocked philosophy.
He was like that of a mad Socrates.
Indeed, he looked like a dog lying under the sun.

I said to him, "If you have a wish, it shall be granted."
The wise man shrugged his shoulder and said,

"Move, you are blocking my sun."

...I see, now that's interesting.
Living a life like that doesn't sound so bad, but it would be a bit difficult for me.

"I will become this era's Old Man, no matter what. 
For that very purpose, I will not hesitate to sacrifice my body. 
At the end, if I am without talent or skill, then I will gladly feed my boring arm to the demon." 

And so, the man sacrificed his right arm to the demon. 
The demon, tricked by the man, entrusted his right arm to him. 
The man finally became the best of the assassins. 
Behold, the terrifying cursed arm. 
The arm that can trick reality and rip the heart out of any mirror image.
It was a fitting demise, for a man who threw way his humanity, and his identity.

There exists a natural evil at the end of this.
There exists a devourer of men, a Minotaur.
As he tries to hide his fear, a man proceeds through the labyrinth with what little courage he has.

He thinks he might die here.
He thinks he might be lost in here forever.
He thinks he might get eaten by the Minotaur.

However, he didn't know the monster was a human...
A human boy who desperately tries to be punished as a monster.

The end is nigh for the both of them.

...I am the son of the great King of Knights.
...I am the arrogant Treacherous Knight.
I am both, and both are myself.
But once I put this helmet on, I am neither of them.
I simply become a living being that you can see everywhere, worthlessly struggling for the right to live.
So just like those that draw their last breath, I guess I will perish like they did.
That's why I want to know, before I leave this world.
 
...Just who the hell was I?

When the fog is thick at night, Jack the Ripper appears.
You can lock your door, close your windows, even hide under your sheets, but Jack will still slip through the keyhole to get you. 
The disgusting sound of dripping blood, accompanied by the sight of dissected bowels. 
Consciousness is fading away, soon you will die of despair. 
Despite that, the last thing you hear before your death is...
"Mother" 
and a strangely pure smile like that of an angel.

Hello there, to you who dreams.
Look upon me with those young eyes.
The world is uncertain, yet the world is kind, everyone is a friend.
The clouds floating there in the sky look like candy!
Your sparkling eyes illuminate the world before you.

Goodbye there, to you who dreamt.
Look upon me with those old eyes.
The whole world is clear, yet the whole world is cruel, everyone has become tired like you.
Even candy has become tasteless!
The sparkling world is what awakens those eyes.

Wonderland is a land of fairy-tales.
Rhymes are the lullaby for dreams...
Not even worth one shilling.
Not guaranteed to last even ten years.
Eventually those sweet memories will fade.
But sweet pain is needed.

Even if you forget about the book, please don't forget what was hidden between the pages.

Nothing more than a scoundrel. No different than a bandit.
Not something you want your name associated with.
A hood and mud suit you well.

Humans do well when they focus on hiding themselves.
No one will hate them, and no one will target them.
If no one depends on them, no one will love them, either.

Whoever thinks that living like that would be easier, they stop being human.
Do you think you've managed to acquire a lot of things?
Unfortunate for you, that's just an illusion.
A man without a face, also has no eyes to see.
He cannot obtain anything.

The sword that beheaded the Earth Spider and exterminated monsters now slays men and steals lives.
All the heroic tales are stories of the past.
I will continue to taint this blade with the blood of men.
I am ashamed my ancestors would see it as thus.
Still, if I were to trouble them further, I would wish this sword to be sharper.
Oh no, I would not ask much, I would merely ask it be capable of taking a hundred heads in one swing.
See, taking lives one person at a time is so bothersome.

In ten steps, I will make my kill.
The self-proclaimed hero is trembling, frozen in fear.
Completely useless, but that's the way it is.
Ultimately, I am the one who made this plan and perfected it.
I can do it at this distance.
I won't be interfered with at this distance.
Just a few more seconds, and I can see his face looking at me, begging for mercy.
Soon, my life will be reaching its end.
My life is filled with joy, I have no regrets.
...Well then, here I come.
It's time to make the leap, to my hated and beloved emperor.

I know it's a little late, but still let me explain.

The Heaven Scorcher Halberd is General Lu's only partner and what makes him special.
It is truly a masterpiece, and the only thing that was allowed in his heart, the heart of a man who claimed he needed no friend and no comrade.
Slash, thrust, strike, sweep, repel.
The weapon utilizes all the qualities that you can find in a two-handed weapon, an almighty and all-purpose weapon, if I may say so myself.
Many people may say, well isn't that because the General wasn't skilled enough to switch weapons depending on the ever-changing battlefield?
I say to those people, you are just jealous of the General's talent in martial arts.
The simple truth is, if he has the time to switch weapons, he might as well use that time to destroy more enemies.
Isn't that a form of courage that's worthy of his nickname the Flying General?

Well, this weapon actually originated from the Northern Song Dynasty, and it shouldn't exist in a time where Lu Bu was alive.
Then why is he holding that weapon you ask?
That's because I went ahead before it's time and secretly developed the weapon.

He said that photographs were his hobby.
That they were a tool to record a world, a grand landscape that's beyond imagination.
He laughed to hide his embarrassment, and then showed me all of the pictures he had taken and saved.
