"I feel like Master's been more cold to me recently."

Ereshkigal feels some distance building between herself and Master. In order to increase her appeal, Dumuzid suggests something out of the ordinary: to use a video sharing platform called "ServantTube"!

Let's celebrate the miracle Carnival together!

The princess of the Autumn Woods fell in love. She fell in love with the prince who, from the moment of his birth, was like a corpse. While the others in the forest were in high spirits upon his arrival, she simply gazed at him from afar. Even when the prince stood up, and even after she caught a glimpse of his heart, the princess never wavered. 

It was the place discarded faeries gathered. Even though the prince ridiculed the other faeries as the dregs of Faerie Britain, he never did move his residence away from the Autumn Woods. 

Whenever he did something good, he would carefully wash his hands in the forest river. Whenever he did something bad, he would collapse on a leaf while his wings were still dirty. The prince loathed everything about Britain. So too did he loathe the faeries of the Autumn Woods. But...

"I’m no god. You can't expect me to care for a bunch of losers who just disappear on their own."

Having learned what the prince truly despised, the princess promised herself she would flap her wings until the end for his sake, believing that she was the only fire that could warm his cold limbs.

◆

This is a fragment of an untold tale—the story of a proud princess a liar hid from the world.

On the first night the sun inhabits Aries, raise this talisman towards the North Gate of the Stone Columns and chant the following:

Zariatnatmix,
Janna, Etitnamus,
Hayras, Fabelleron, Fubentronty

Then behold as the king of the forest and the one of a thousand horns come to walk this world once again, and enjoy all the pleasures it has to offer.

This is who I am.

The garish gleam of vulgar gold. Shackles, the antithesis of freedom. The heavy chains' irritating rattling invites scorn and mockery. It could not be clearer to all that the one who wears them is defeated. These marks of humiliation prove to all who behold them that their bearer is guilty of a grievous mistake, and so has been reduced to such a pitiful state.

But now, we are the beholders. We see these shackles unlocked, from without.

The gleam becomes ordinary. They no longer offer any impediment to one's freedom. They lie, abandoned, in the desert sands.

And so, I say again:

This is who I am.

My shiny glass slippers... My gallant pumpkin carriage... My ordinary, non-flying brooms... They're all taking a well-deserved night off.

It's not as though Cinderella wears her glass slippers ALL the time. They're for when you really mean business.

Hm? When do I really mean business? Well, for me, the days when I sing, so...pretty much every day!

Okay, everyone, sorry to butt into your break, but it's time to get to work! Glass slippers, on! Pumpkin carriage, prepare to roll out! Okay, time to get out there and sing my heart out!

Intersecting souls, so passionate and intense that they seem to melt.
Battles beyond human intellect shall unfold tonight under the pale blue moon.
The night has just begun.

The spear that fell from the heavens is the light of the gods themselves.

It was cast down to usher humans into godhood, and orochi into dragons.

The creature that was cast out of the kingdom of gods due to fear and loathing, and despised as a nation-devouring monstrosity, was supposed to feed. Everyone, including the creature herself, thought she would feed on her anger, her grief, and her resentment until her malice swallowed her whole. She would inevitably transform into the nation-devouring calamity the gods always suspected she would become.

But all that went away with a single man's kindhearted remark.

The monstrous nation-devourer couldn't tell whether that was a good thing or a bad thing. But by then, neither of them cared. All they wanted was to be together, forever. That was all they needed.

And while it took several bizarre twists of fate for it to happen, their wish—their promise—was eventually fulfilled.

Even if their newly found time together was no more than a fleeting illusion, it didn't matter. All that mattered was that they could finally tell each other what they'd always wanted to say:

"I'm glad I met you."

That...was the incident at sea.

It's said that the puppet samurai was once controlled by a great shrine maiden of the past.

Long, long ago, there was a god of the earthly domain who possessed incomparable power. He hunted beasts, vanquished evil, and carried battles to victory. But after many years of fighting to protect humankind, that god was betrayed and killed by those same humans. Yet even after being run through with their blades, the god spoke not a word of anger or resentment towards his killers. Instead, he merely accepted his fate.

Thus did this god and protector of humankind have his body cruelly cut to pieces, his name stolen, and his existence as a deity ended by the very people he had spent his life protecting.

Well, I don't know if that's actually true or not, but regardless, that's Zanzaburo's story.

At any rate, when I found him in the treasury, he was so shabby that I genuinely couldn't believe he was actually the legendary husk of an ancient god. Still, as I was looking at his beat-up face, I found myself feeling so sorry for him that I decided to fix up his armor and helmet. That's how he became the Zanzaburo he is today.

Afterwards, we began traveling together, dancing together, and vanquishing evil together.

I may not know who my parents were, or where I was born, or really anything about myself, so in one sense, Zanzaburo is really the only family I have...

Oh, but that's enough for the sappiness. It looks like we've still got some trouble ahead of us tonight. There are dangerous creatures out there that we'll need to take care of with our evil-slaying dance.

Wake up, Zanzaburo!

That's right. Even as a husk, this god whose name was lost to time continues to serve as humankind's guardian.

So, while you may already know that Ranmaru is THE Ranmaru among Ranmarus, what you may not know is just how much work Ranmaru had to put in to become the Ranmaru Ranmaru is today.

For as long as Ranmaru can remember, Ranmaru attended Ranmaru School to learn what it takes to be Ranmaru. Ranmaru also went to Interstellar Flying Sword cram school three times a week, fighting the urge to grab a bite to eat on the way home by making do with bitter bell peppers. Those were definitely not easy days for Ranmaru. But fortunately, they're also far in the past now that Ranmaru has achieved Ranmaru's life dream of finding a lord Ranmaru can serve with pride for the rest of Ranmaru's life.

Even though Ranmaru holds the title of Mysterious Ranmaru X, Ranmaru never knew what the "Mysterious" part meant. But now, Ranmaru thinks Ranmaru understands. It's something very important Ranmaru was looking for, even if Ranmaru didn't yet know it at the time.

It's a wish that crossed boundless distance to tie our planets together, along with a voice Ranmaru hadn't heard in a long time.

Ranmaru hopes you'll let Ranmaru stay by your side forever and ever, Master!

...Man, what a beautiful sky. I really mean that. I mean, I had a pretty rough time of it growing up, you know? I don't think it would've even occurred to me to just gaze up at the sky like this back then.

How can I put this... I guess changing my Spirit Origin helped me make a new discovery? It's not often that I realize something new like this. Heck, maybe I still haven't, and this is all just in my head. But, even if it is...that's okay with me. In fact, it's plenty!

Just being able to imagine a life that might have been—one where I went around with Big Sis just having fun cooking lots of yummy things for lots of different people, without making any trouble for anyone—well, that's all I need to hold my head high and look up at the sky.

Dǎ Shén Biān; The God-Striking Whip. Noble Phantasm and Paopei.
A type of Conceptual Weapon bestowed upon Taigong Wang when he was charged with sealing away a god.
As its name suggests, it is a whip meant for defeating gods, and therefore possesses unparalleled strength against supernatural beings and those who lack natural lifespans.

"This weapon doesn't care who or what it fights. Most foes will die if you use this to shatter their skull."

Well, that's pretty obvious. Just about every living thing will die if it has their skull shattered, no matter what is used to do it.

This is not a whip in the traditional sense, as it lacks rope or string. Instead, it's more of a bar-shaped weapon meant for direct bludgeoning. Taigong Wang apparently prefers it over bladed weapons.

"It kind of looks like a fishing pole, right? ...Okay, maybe that's a stretch, but it certainly looks more like one than a sword. Besides, there's something elegant about how it doesn't look much like a traditional weapon at all. Hmm, how can I put this...? Oh, I know! It's not barbaric at all!"

Ah, I see. Well that makes sense. So how do you fight with this whip then?

"Mostly by shattering my opponents' skulls."

...I see. Nothing barbaric about that at all. I mean, who doesn't think of skull smashing when they think of elegance?

Zmei Gorynych, the three-headed dragon. Yup. He was strong. The story of how I defeated him is probably Dobrynya Nikitich's most famous legend. Know what that means? It means I'm stronger than he was.

Hm? You think the bylina where I leave my wife behind to go on a long journey is more famous?
I-I, um...want to say you're wrong, but... Hmm.

What did my wife think about it? Hmm, good question. I'm sure she wasn't happy for her beloved husband to be away for so long. Especially when he apparently couldn't be bothered to send her so much as a single letter.
Hm? These days, that kind of abandonment would get me divorced? Well—

"Hey. Can I say something?"

Hm? What is it, Zmei? You always were really chatty for a dragon.

"I thought we were talking about me. Why're you talking about your marriage instead?"

Hahaha, good point! But don't worry about it! Life's too short to sweat the small stuff!

Hey Master, did you know that if a lion dance bites you, you become a natural ward against evil?
...I mean, I don't really care about that kind of thing, but since it's a new year and all, I might as well try, right?
Okay, here goes!

"Roaaar! Chomp!
...How was that?"

Thus, once again, the alchemist watched over the lion cub with a smile on her face as he took advantage of their time alone to behave like one of his Marines.

I had a dream in that moment right before your conscious mind shuts off for the night.

I dreamed that we were all together in one place, under a clear blue winter sky. I dreamed everyone was happy to see me.

Does the fact that I had a dream like that mean that...I actually wanted to be friends with them?

Man, I really hope not.

"NFF Services' corporate vision? Why, it's to serve all of humanity in a revolutionary new way. I founded NFF Services in order to better provide for all your precious needs. And not just fundamental ones like food, shelter, and clothing, but also hopes, dreams, love, and desire."

Of course, when Koyanskaya says "serve," she means "dominate," and when she says "provide," she means "control." In time, she hopes to grow her "Ideals Fulfilled" service so that it is an essential part of human life, thereby creating a society that is completely dependent upon her.
For Koyanskaya's ultimate goal is to dismantle human nations based on reason and logic and replace them with an authoritarian state that runs on business and economics.

"I refuse to let the human race decline because it reaches its limits. That is why NFF Services will buy up all manner of anger, envy, grudges, suffering, and other such evil things. As long as I'm around, I'll never let you go extinct. All you have to worry about is buying the products I provide you."

Even now, all sorts of products are being made at her giant factory that resembles a hat.
Homes. Success. Happiness. Futures. The only product that remains mysteriously forever out of stock is the one called "Freedom."
And so, the beautiful woman that embodies the concept of taming itself smiles a thin smile as she manipulates all the animals of this planet in the figurative palm of her hand.

"That being said, don't let this go to your heads. Every bit of potential you humans possess can fit comfortably inside my hat. If anything you do displeases me, I'll simply throw it away into the forest. So for your own sakes, I implore you not to get carried away and start thinking of yourselves as more capable than you really are, okay?"

Naivete. Failure. Foolishness. Every time she looks at this little scrap, these things leap to mind.

Once, she had a king she swore to protect. After he was injured on the battlefield, she took up the mantle he had been wearing. Every time she looks at that mantle, she is filled with both rage and shame over her failure. These feelings are what pushed her to stand tall on countless battlefields later in her life.

...Even now, those feelings remain unchanged. She cannot, however, deny that another feeling has joined them. Now, she begrudgingly accepts that there are others who want to share her naivete and foolishness.

Though her anger and regret will never fade, she nonetheless continues to walk her king's path...this time, with just a hint of pride.

Manannan mac Lir's legendary white steed, capable of running on both land and sea. Needless to say, he's also very good at pulling chariots when necessary. Manannan is the Celtic god of the sea, which is why some people believe this steed's color is meant to be the white of sea foam.

"Oh, you're talking about the horse I ride as a goddess, huh? Yes, he certainly is a Noble Phantasm-level concept. And yes, even as a mage, I was able to ride him. Sometimes, when you're chasing down seal designated mages, horses can go places cars and motorcycles can't.

That said...when most people think of a white horse, they probably imagine a prince riding in to sweep a princess off her feet. It's almost a little too romantic—or maybe I should say, juvenile or girlish? ...Oh, but I'm not making light of it. It's a little embarrassing to say this, but...I think, maybe, someday, I might meet a prince of my own...

Huh? What kind of prince am I looking for? Well, ideally, I'd like someone brave, learned, wise...a strong leader everybody likes, and who's also modest and humble without the slightest trace of pride or arrogance...

Hey, where are you going? Huh? You think all that's too much to ask for? Well, I don't! I'm sure he's out there somewhere! I just haven't met him yet!"

"What are you two, anyway?"

The answer remains a mystery. All we know for certain is that these tiny elephants were summoned along with the sisters they now accompany. Are they alive? Familiars? Phantasmals? Something else entirely? Nobody knows for sure. That being said...there are times Trưng Trắc feels like these elephants inspire her to do her very best. Times they help her realize that, even with her various shortcomings, both real and imagined, there are still people out there counting on her and her sister for help. Times their eyes remind her of all the people who once gave her strength... And so, she sometimes thinks they may actually be the very people she and Nhị once knew. Though of course, if they are, that raises its own questions. At any rate...

"Even if they don't know who we are, both sisters think we're adorable and consider us trusted partners, tarantara!"
"Definitely. It's a big relief. Now let's get back to our trunk-rubbing game, tarantara!"
"You're on, tarantara!"

"Uh... What are you doing, Sister?"
"Huh!? U-uh, n-nothing. Definitely not pretending to give both elephants voices or anything like that. Nope."

Waking up always makes me think of the sky. It's so unlike the soil I've been buried in all this time. The brilliant blue seems to stretch out forever...the place my planet lives. It's not that I'm jealous or anything. I have no desire to claim it for myself. I know I belong elsewhere. My job is to curse those who break the law, and I've never had second thoughts about it.

Even so, when I do wake up, I can't help but notice the sky hanging high over me. After all...a mass of flesh like me could never hope to reach it.

Still, it would be nice to learn how sunbathing feels, especially under a free and open sky. I can't deny that thought has crossed my mind.

I came to this world from a land where elementals roam free. I gave you names, taught you how to speak, and shared my wisdom with you—including how to make maple syrup. So I really think you could stand to show more in the way of appreciation than you have been.

Before we had a change of heart thanks to our master's teachings, we were no more than base creatures who only lived to fill our bellies and grow our numbers.

Now, thanks to our noble master, we have gained new purpose as his servants. We will never return to the days of being mere animals sneaking bites of food ever again.

That sea took hold of me and never let go.

As its waves washed over me, my heart wore down to a smooth nub.
I could no longer feel anything. As the earth buried me, I died one tiny piece at a time.
Eventually, nothing of me remained, and I was forgotten completely.
Nobody needed me...so why couldn't I just run away?

Although Bunyan joined the upper echelon of Servant stardom after being added to FGO, that fame hasn't gone to her head at all. Even when she runs into former colleagues, she greets them with the same friendly attitude she always did, without a single sign of displeasure.

It's okay to lose a fistfight. It's okay to lose a duel. But this right here? This is what happens when you lose a war. People killed...slaves dragged through the streets...everything we worked so hard to build disappearing.

Was there no other way? Was there no different path we could have taken, however small? This is all the meaningless drivel that inevitably fills my head in the wake of all this. I know you're still here. But...you alone don't make any difference. Not when everything else we were supposed to protect is gone.

Ahh, my towering ramparts, my indomitable three-layer bulwark. Do not cry; tears are the sole right of the civilians I should have protected. You...you may only rage. Rage like a demon. Rage like chaos itself. That is the only right left to you.

This is my sword, Joyeuse! What do you think? Pretty awesome, right!? Some stories say it changes color thirty times a day... Some say there's a sacred spear hidden in its hilt... And there's probably a bunch of others I can't even remember. But all you really need to know about it is who it'll cut, and who it won't. This is the sword of a king, or of a hero if you prefer. It can transform into a demonic blade, or devolve into a sword of fools, depending on who's wielding it. That's why, whenever I take it out of its scabbard, I always ask my allies, "Am I awesome right now?"

Then again, they've never given any answer but "yes," so I guess I don't have anything to worry about!

One could make a very strong argument that numbers are themselves humanity's greatest achievement. Addition, subtraction, multiplication, division... From these fundamentals, we can measure an object's size, the distance between two points, and everything else. No being can exist in reality and not be subject to numbers. What's more, numbers can also invite malignancy. If killing a hundred people can save the lives of a thousand more, then surely someone out there will readily bear the burden of such a sin. The fact is, humans can no longer live their lives with the unadorned simplicity of mere beasts. Thus, we have logical malignance, as collected in the very instruments you see here.

All right, everyone, I'm James Moriarty, and this has been my lecture on mathematics. Make sure you submit your reports before deadline!

Unparalleled freedom. Incomparable liberation. Behold how the sun's rays shine down from the pale blue sky. Look to the fluffy white clouds, the vivid green of the grass and trees. (Can't deny the former kind of tickles my back, though!)

It doesn't get any better than this. This right here is how everyone should live their life. Put yourself out there without holding anything back, and there's no problem that can't be solved. Well, almost no problem. For example, the problem I'm dealing with right now is—



Aw, crap! What happened to my clothes!?

Ahh, Dulcinea! My beautiful, perfect princess! I, Don Quixote de la Mancha, have just returned from a grand adventure on which I told the whole world about your delicate beauty and incredible nobility!

Huh? You have something you wish to say about the cute maid I traveled with? Um, my lady, with all due respect, I think you may be mistaken. My friend Sancho Panza is a paunchy, middle-aged man, not a cute maid... What's that? Sancho is who you wish to ask about?

Why, Sancho is my dearest friend, and the best attendant a knight could ask for! If it hadn't been for him, my glorious, perilous journey would have faded into obscurity long ago!

Huh? You want me to tell you more? Very well then, allow me to regale you with one of the many stories from our grand adventure...

Ahh, that was delightful. It's true; the adventure I shared with you was beautiful. I will never forget it.

So, this is the Rheingold—the fabled and ruinous treasure my ex-husband, ex-prince, and ex-adventurer Siegfried went to such great lengths to acquire.

Do you know why I wished to obtain this treasure for myself?
Hehe, I won't be surprised if you don't.

...Yes, that's right. Because I wanted to destroy it. It's worthless. Utterly worthless. Maybe magecraft types consider it valuable, but to me, it's nothing more than a lump of yellow rock. I should have melted it down and turned it into medallions long ago.

You know, you ought to be careful too, Master. The glitter of gold can turn hearts as well as eyes. It could lead to someone you trust betraying you, or you betraying them. Which is why I'm going to teach you an easy trick for dealing with it. All you have to do is use it all up. Spend it all on whatever you like, because it has no worth otherwise. That's right. Use it up, share the wealth, and any curse or calamity associated it will simply disappear. That is the nature of cursed gold.

One of the yellow scarves worn as turbans by disciples of the Way of the Taiping. There are numerous explanations as to why this color was chosen, with the Five Elements theory claiming that it was a sign of faith in the Yellow Emperor. Regardless of the color's origins, we do know that those who chose to stand up to the Han Dynasty while wearing one of these scarves did so because they believed it would lead to a brighter future.

"Hoohoho. True, I doubt many people who wore these scarves truly understood everything about the Way of the Taiping. But, even so...there was a sense of unity in seeing everyone wearing the same color. Of course I remember the droves of people who stood together, all with these yellow scarves wrapped around their heads. I remember how they listened closely to what I said, their eyes glittering bright. Yes... Thinking back on it now, perhaps that very sight is what we all truly sought. Seeing all those Yellow Turbans covering the land everywhere you look was like seeing the most bountiful rice harvest you could imagine coming to life..."

Yes, this was the color that bound Zhang Jue and the people who looked up to him. A mark of their lives that he can still see clearly whenever he closes his eyes.

The "Nansou Satomi Eight Dog Chronicles" consists of nine sokan (volumes), ninety-eight scrolls, and one-hundred and six serials. Published over twenty-eight years, this grand epic took Kyokutei Bakin nearly half his life to complete. Kabuki and joururi productions have been a fixture of Japanese theater going all the way back to the Edo period, and its influences on various works across countless genres cannot be overstated.

Bakin served as a page until he decided to set out on his own path at a young age, during which he wrote the following haiku:

"Chilled by winter winds
I have made a decision
To journey with gods"

While certainly an arrogant haiku in that it compares Bakin to the gods who gather in Izumo during Kannazuki, the tenth month of the lunar calendar, one could make a strong argument that the "Eight Dog Chronicles" is itself the journey Bakin decided to undertake.

I nock an arrow to my bow and loose it. Its arrowhead easily bores through its target's body. Broadly speaking, human bodies are little more than bags of meat and water. At high speeds, anything sharp can penetrate and, most likely, cause them to cease functioning.

So then, what if... What if a monster, like myself, were to fire upon people? My arrow gouges out five, ten bodies at a time, and destroys castle gates as though they were made of paper.

So then, what about a ship? ...See for yourself. My arrow tore it apart, dooming its passengers to drown.

While I should perhaps be elated over this accomplishment, my heart also cannot help but ache a bit. Dying to an arrow may be glorious, but dying because your ship was destroyed, without even setting foot on a battlefield, must be anything but.

The arrow I fired was not one of mercy. Far from it. So please, Master, I implore you to remember this. We may find honor in battle and death, and are thus unafraid to face them. But what is rarely discussed is how countless people have met cruel...far too cruel ends like these.

No, as ridiculous as it may sound coming from a machine built for battle like myself...there is nothing good about war.

Huh. Hey, Master. Have you seen my parasol anywhere? That's weird. I must have forgotten it somewhere. Except...I tied it to my Spirit Origin with magical energy, so it should come right back to me...

Maybe I left it back there. Hmm. Well, if that's the case, it should be fine. Let's just say my parasol likes that place even more than I do.

That said, I still want a parasol, so I think I'll make a new one!

The sword that once belonged to the Red Knight... This red mystic blade broke in half during battle, and now lies shattered upon the earth.

She should know; she was the one who broke it. Using a lance that had been enchanted by the great mage Merlin, she expertly evaded the Red Knights' defenses and smote his mystic sword, cleaving it in two.

According to Merlin, the Red Knight was a physical incarnation of evil and disaster. If that's true...does that mean she saved Britain from a looming threat? That she triumphed over calamity?

...There was no response. As though the silence itself speaks to the endless catastrophes that have yet to come. The young Gareth peers down at the mystic blade lying broken at her feet, completely silent.

One pair of rings (for a giant groom and a human bride) sits next to a white flower. The other pair (for a human groom and a giant bride) sits next to a yellow one. Both pairs lie atop a solid white platform that could be either a marble table or an ancient pedestal.

This is the scene depicted on the final page of her story. Only it isn't the story she published back in summer. This scene is from its sequel... A scene from a side story; a scene so secret it still remains buried deep in her heart.

Perhaps one day, the time to tell this story will come.

Or, perhaps not...

Keh heh heh! I must say, it is nice to take a holiday every now and then.

Now go on, Master. You see that sunscreen on the table, yes? Well, then hurry up and put it on me. I am sure it will be more satisfying for you than if I were still in my small Assassin form. Consider it your reward for a job well done. Savor this good fortune while it lasts. But be sure you do not confuse the sunscreen for the chicken blood. That would make a mess in more ways than one.

Hm? You wish to know why I also have these Taoist instruments here? Why, there is no telling when undead monstrosities may intrude upon this beach, of course. If I am going to exorcise such spirit creatures, I may as well get it out of the way. So this summer, I am going to hunt down every last spirit beast I can find and add all those lost corpses to my jiāngshī army! Or at least, that is my goal. I am prepared to face them no matter when they appear, and that includes during the day. Hence, the sunscreen. Now hurry and put it on me already!

...Ohhh. Now I understand. You are dragging your feet to give yourself as much time as possible to admire me in my swimsuit, aren't you? Well, aren't you adorable. Very well then, in that case...

Even when she's supposed to be on summer vacation, the hard-working empress never forgets her duties.

I wanted her to at least relax while she was out here, so I put on sunscreen like she asked. As a reward, she gave me a jiāngshī talisman that she claimed had been custom-made.

When I turned it over, I found a pinup-style picture of her in her swimsuit.

Hey, you know those things I carry around when I'm in my cheerleader outfit, right? Those really cute, bushy things? What're they called again? Uhhh...yeah, pom-poms. I really love them, you know? And not just for dancing, either. When I hold the pom-poms up and shout, "Wooo! Wooo!" I can feel myself and those around me getting more cheerful by the second. No, it's not just cheer. I can feel magical energy surging, too!

...Hey, what's with the look!? You don't believe me, do you!? All right then, I'll show you. Watch this.

Wooo! Wooo! Gooo, Master! Yeah!

How was that? Don't you feel more cheerful now? ...See? I knew it. Okay, let's do it again! Again!

(Hic)

The official plushies of Schwapp Erize Land. Includes plushies that can sit or stand and plushies that are meant to lie flat on their bellies. These are the trusty friends and allies of the sea who call Schwapp Erize Land home. Now let's join them on a voyage filled with adventure and romance! Bon voyage!

"Wha...? When did we order these!? Th-this is the first I'm hearing about them! I mean, um, I'm not saying we can't sell them. It's just... Well... Wait. Um, do you think you could leave those samples here? Don't worry. I'll, um, make sure they're taken care of."

A garish gun lies all alone in a Scandinavian forest. Its model name is NKS1867/4TO. It used to be a shield made from divine iron before being newly minted into the form of a gun. It's the Valkyries' newest armament, given to them automatically when they transform into their new Assassin summer Spirit Origins.

At times, this gun has been called "the final weapon."

...The best trump cards are always saved until the very end.

A dull steel-colored lump of metal rests on its side at the edge of a forest near the fjord. Its model name is SAM66. It is a submachine gun made from Gungnir, the Noble Phantasm, modeled after the demonic lance Noble Phantasm said to have once been wielded by Odin the Allfather himself. It's the Valkyries' newest armament, given to them automatically when they transform into their new Assassin summer Spirit Origins.

Why a gun? Two possible explanations come to mind: It may be that Thrúd, Hildr, and Ortlinde were influenced by the first-person shooter they've been playing on Tomoe Gozen's recommendation. Or maybe Odin's got a thing for guns.

One explanation is as likely as the other.

A short rest taken in the wilds of Scandinavia. It's nice to forget all about fighting, even briefly.

...The rations include a mead-like elixir. These are the Valkyries' new provisions, given to them automatically when they transform into their new Assassin summer Spirit Origins. Most importantly, they're just really, really good!

Word has it that Ortlinde and Irs are especially fond of the elixir, and how it tastes so much like mead.

What would things be like now if that fateful encounter had happened differently?
Maybe we'd be looking at Heroic Spirits in completely new outfits.

After the princess returned to the planet's inner sea, her memories became a seed, which became a flower blooming by the lake.

It was the only flower of its kind on the surface, unlike the primordial type he said she resembled.

When you look at it, it speaks to you as though it were telling your romance fortune; as if it were fondly reminiscing; as if it were in the middle of a dream.

"No matter how far apart we may be, may you never forget the light of the moon."

Refrain. Refrain.
I only hope the sound of these waves can be heard in his world as well.

　　◆

...Still, aaall that being said...

"Well excuuuse me for being a tomboy princess!"

I can also perfectly remember every last cutting remark!

Phew... Looks like my role is just about done.
Oh, this spell isn't right. Fix it, okay?
The rest is up to all of you now...
Oh yeah, this'll totally work. You did a great job with this talisman. All you have to do now is learn how to pick up the pace.
Man, it's hard to believe it's been decades since that avalanche trapped us in this land. I'm amazed I held out this long... Huh? Really? Is that true?
Hmm. Sorry, but would you mind giving it another shot from the beginning?
Like I was saying, I'm amazed I... Uh, what was I saying again...?
Huh? The dolls are going seriously berserk? Their inner spells probably just need stabilizing. Try keeping an eye on the weather and...
Oh, right. Now where was I on my will...?
Ugh, dammit! At this rate, I'll never have time to die!

Like water.
Let the anger that rages through you flow away freely, magnanimously, and gracefully...like flowing water.

Like flowers.
Let your thoughts return to your distant hometown, conjuring radiant and cheerful feelings...like a flower blooming in the field.

Parents who were separated from their daughter, and the daughter who was separated from her parents. The two sentiments which had nowhere to meet in this land.

One, enraged by its circumstance. The other, saddened by its state. Each pitied the other, and then their souls joined. They did so to aid one another, if they were comforting each other. The two souls united, as they were, in harmony and order.

"In this way, Komahime shall be Rikyu, and Rikyu shall be Komahime."

Think of this chashaku, this bamboo tea scoop, as Rikyu and this tea caddy as Komahime. We've put our gratitude to you, who accepted us as we are, into this session of tea.

...Like Water, Like Flowers.

Kondo. I am prepared.

Hijikata. Use me as an example for everyone in the Shinsengumi.

Saito. I want you to support Hijikata.

Nagakura. Your unfettered words will play an important role for the troupe.

Harada. Your likeable personality will surely raise everyone's morale.

Mister Ito. Please share your wisdom and observations with everyone.

Toudo. I take responsibility for everything. You mustn't resent the Captain.

Genzaburo. Someone like you should be cherished.

Okita. I'm sorry for causing you so much trouble.

I ask you all to look straight ahead. I may have made the mistake of looking backward, but I want you all to look ahead and keep walking, my comrades who have assembled under the banner of sincerity.

I am here right now. I do not know if that is a punishment or a crime, but I will still look ahead and walk with you as long as possible. Let's walk together, just like on the day when we wished for our future.

A baby was born. For some reason, the baby never uttered a single cry, but she was gripping her fist tight. Inside her hand, there was a magatama as black as onyx.

Soon after, the baby's parents died of an epidemic. The baby was adopted by relatives in the clan. In her hand, there was a magatama as black as onyx.

When the baby grew into a child, her relatives died in a war. The clan tried to isolate the child from everyone. In her hand, there was a magatama as black as onyx.

When the child grew to be a young girl, the entire clan died from illness, natural disasters, war, and famine. Every type of terrifying calamity plagued the people and ultimately killed them. In her hand, there was a magatama as black as onyx.

The girl grew up hearing she should never have been born. She cursed herself for being born. But on she lived, being cursed by those around her and cursing them in turn. In the shrine maiden's hand was a magatama as black as onyx.

Everything stemmed from this magatama...the power of the shrine maiden of destruction. But that was probably just everyone’s imagination. There is no sin in being born. She only realized this when...there was someone who believed so.

“That’s why, Future, I want you to prove something with me. I want to prove that this power saves people...maybe even the world!”

...The magatama as black as onyx will likely never shine again.

"If there was even just one thing, or a single person who was left out..."
A story that is both prequel and sequel, unfolding along a series of what ifs.
The story of a boy and a vampire continues even to this day.

Splendid, so bright and beautiful.
May all the deceased rest in peace, while all survivors be spurred onward.

The usually rough-and-tumble warriors are solemn right now, and look to the Taoist priests.
They all stood up for the cause. They slaughtered the villains. They roused the people.
And so they charged through, believing their path was just, with the stars in heaven watching over everything they did.
The scattering petals blanket the air like haze. Words to mourn the dead sounds like music to one's ears. Only the warriors' proud aspirations reside in their hearts.

...This is like a dream that will soon disappear.

An unusual warbler, said to have been obtained from the northern sea. And while its detail are unknown, it's powerful enough to scar Daji's face and drive her away. Originally it was placed inside a red birdcage, but as it became a part of Huang Feihu upon his manifestation as a Servant, the bird now enjoys its freedom perched on the Servant's shoulders.
Whenever Huang Feihu goes out on missions with Servants like Semiramis and swimsuit Kama, the warbler can often be seen chatting with the doves and parrots in bird language.
By the way, when someone jokingly asks what the birds are talking about to those who could understand animal language, they all look away and say, "it's better you don't know."

Did you know!? Did you know!? Shi Jin is so awesome!
He can stretch REALLY long! He can fly and spin around the sky! He can spit fire out from his mouth! He can even turn into a pair of stilts so I can ride him!
But the biggest secret is...Shi Jin can talk! He can't talk for too long, but he talks to me a lot when I'm feeling lonely! And that's why I LOVE Shi Jin! We're going to be together forever!

Of course, my friend. My partner.
Even if we wake up from our dream and return to our original form. And even if we remember our bond cannot be realized...
My soul will be with you till the lowest part of hell.

This dress is the official attire Mother, the first Tam Lin Britomart, wore. Oh, have I mentioned that before? Well it's very special. Wearing this brings out my true power as a Tam Lin. Which means...I still cannot say I am a true Tam Lin without borrowing Mother's power. Huh, what's that? "Do your best and hang in there"? Heh heh! You really do say the silliest things! But I'm well aware. I'll give it my very best effort, for sure!

Ocelomeh: jaguar warriors. Each warrior channels the might and spirit of a jaguar, making them a formidable foe in battle. This mask is proof of that. No matter the time or flesh, the inner spirit-beast will be one with you.

"Well, Mesoamerica also has warriors called cuauhtin who call eagles into themselves. Ocelomeh is more like an umbrella term for warriors, but eh, you don't really need to worry about that."

You can dislike weapons, but don't forget your weapon. I am the god of war and the symbol of royalty. I keep the traditions, and I have my mood swings, but I always keep my promises. I won't turn you down, even if you're a weak warrior. We'll find a way to overcome your weakness. I respect anyone with the will to fight. This mask will make your blood surge, just like a jungle beast sharpening its fangs in the dark.

　　◆

"I should warn you, though: I'm the god of jaguar warriors, not the god of jaguars. I'm a snake god like Quetzalcoatl. The feathered serpent rules over agriculture and the good harvest. The thundering serpent commands war and victory. Jaguars are the most powerful sacred beasts in Mesoamerica, while I was the most venerated god. That's how I got associated with them."

In battle, Nitocris Alter summons and commands this Divine Beast of ancient Egypt. The Ammit is a native of the underworld which bears the head of a crocodile. It is more akin to a physical law or phenomenon than a living creature, and is said to dwarf a sphinx at its largest size.

"Contractor, contractor. Convey this message to Pharaoh Ozymandias: My Ammit is separate from the massive creature stabled in the base of Ramesseum Tentyris. Honestly, his misunderstanding has caused me no end of trouble.

What? Why don't I just...tell him myself?

Know this, contractor. I am, well, a little busy. Just a little, but busy nonetheless. Too occupied to involve myself with such trifles, I mean. Anyway, pass the message on. Please. I can count on you to tell him, right?"

Now, I'd like you to remember the fun times, so instead of a weapon, here's something you can use in your normal life. Even after I'm gone, whenever that happens, this should stay with you. It's my favorite jacket, and my very first gift.

　　◆

I bought it without thinking about anything like whether it'd look good on me or wanting to show off for someone's benefit. Bright, easy, gentle colors... I shaped my heart and body in hopes of being a god who fit those colors.

That said, being a god, I figured desiring luxuries of human society would be...vulgar. It could demean my godly status, so I was really, really, REALLY patient! I almost bought it so many times, then didn't! But one day, when I was really feeling down in the dumps, they said...

"Please, take this. You remind me of someone who would have looked good in it."

I liked the hairpin too, of course, but the mention of reminding them of someone who would have looked good in it was what really made me happy. I could tell what that someone was like from the deep affection in their eyes. That's when this self-styled god, who hadn't learned to be confident yet, came to understand feelings like desire, temperance, and satisfaction from a job well done!

As for where my travels took me next, that's a story for another day. Maybe I'll tell you someday if you work hard to reward my faith in you. Even though it all ended in an instant...I had the biggest, sunniest smile on my face until the very end, didn't I?

No matter how favorable the geography, clever the urban planning, or abundant nature's bounty, one always feels a little reluctant about resettling in an unfamiliar land. Yes, humans get attached to their land and buildings. I understand why you won't take the leap and move into me. But you need to make decisions that improve your life, and I've come up with a safe, foolproof plan to help you do that.

"Bring your current life to a brand new world! I guarantee that your lifestyle won't change a bit, even in a new country! Just sign here, then I'll explain!"

That's my presentation, from a capable city god. Oh, don't look TOO happy. Wait, you're not happy. You're surprised? Well, that makes two of us. By the way, this is going to be the first model study, so I'll be moving in with you. It's new housing, so surely there isn't a problem...is there?

No matter how many times she may fall, the bellows will continue rekindling her flame. Her passion is like a meteor rushing back up from Limbo.

The Sea of Stagnation. The Forest of Regret. The Garden of Oblivion. The Forest of Reverberation. The Town of Noise. The Grave of Infinity. The Summit of the Sun. The seven monuments have reversed the phases of death.

O stars of heaven, please give her a hearty ovation. May the last falling star lead to a glorious end.

This is a story of EXTRA that will unfold on a forgotten moon.
The Mooncell Automaton, a Spiritron computer that exists on the moon, grants any and all wishes.
A virtual Spiritron world created within the Mooncell is SE.RA.PH. With the "Holy Grail" on the line, Wizards and Servants must now wage a brand new Holy Grail War of the Moon.

A girl summoned from a parallel world that was never meant to intersect with this one. She is a member of the Security Organization for the Preservation of Humanity, Finis Chaldea, and a Demi-Servant, a human fused with a Heroic Spirit.

In this story, an unforeseen error brings her into a nest of mysterious creatures in a world she knows nothing about.

Shrouded with wrathful, blue-black flames, the Count of Monte Cristo is the most renowned "Avenger" in the world.

In an attempt to save a certain someone, he crosses the boundaries of the world and appears in the city of Souya. What does this world look like when seen through his eyes?

The childhood form of the military commander who later left a mark on Japan's history as Minamoto-no-Yoshitsune. Upon her summoning from the Throne of Heroes, she appears in 21st century Japan, rather than Chaldea, and what appears before her is a mysterious creature that looks to be half-cat and half-human...

A new chapter in "The Wandering Tales of Shana-oh" begins now.

Congratulations. Thank you. I'm glad to know you.

You have someone to say that to you. It's a wonderful thing, to be sure, not only to think that, but have it thought of you. May we all be so lucky.

With a sunny smile, Happy New Year!

Now that all is lost, even the calendar itself, seasonal events are totally meaningless. But these guys still can't help themselves. Guess I gotta play along. While being surrounded by such noisy busybodies isn't as bad as I'd have thought...it's also a little lonely.

I wonder what you'd do if you were here. I bet you'd fit in and join the fun faster than you think.

It is said that he was shot four or five times.

He ate a poisoned meal and did not fall. He was shot in the vitals, but got back up. They tossed him into the wintry river.

No one alive today can say whether his actions were good or evil. All we know for sure is that history recorded him as a friend of the tsar, an opponent of war, and a messenger of God's love to the people of the motherland.

Intrigue. Threats. Deceit. Diplomacy. Poisoning. Assassination. He faced many challenges, but didn't take them lying down. He resisted until his final hour.

Flesh may crumble, but faith stands strong.
Ideals may drift, but conviction holds true.
It will never fade or be defeated.
No weapon or person ever managed to change his way of life.

　◆

He came from a poor farm, knowing little of Scripture. A seed budding in a barren land, as if to declare itself a miracle of the Lord.

My story may be absurd and full of twists and turns, but my life began when I decided to write my feelings down. Even if there's no proof I ever lived, I've recorded my thoughts here. The days I spent in Chaldea, those simple pleasures, all my friends, the wonderful times...this beautiful account of it all. These facts will never change, and neither will this record of my time here.

That is why I leave this diary to you, Master. One day, when I've written the final page and faded away as if I were never here, I'd like you to unravel these feelings...all of this. 

It should go without saying, but...please don't read it while I'm still here. Okay? Promise!

"Well, guess it's time to get up."

During the turbulent times of a certain nation, while many young people were concerned about their nation and stood up for it, there was a man who was defeated before his ambitions were fulfilled. Well, that fact itself wasn't that unusual. Everyone at that time lived fast and recklessly. Some were even scrambling to be the first to die. Then again, they probably would have liked to spend a little longer causing trouble, if they had a chance.

The man awakes once again, not knowing if his wish came true, or if it was a twisted whim of fate. Alongside the youth of a new age, he confronted the crisis in Japan—nay, the plight for humanity's survival.

Hahahahaha! Fine by me! If I'm getting summoned, the crisis better be a desperate one! Stronger enemies and greater obstacles only mean more fun! Don't you think so too? Yeah, a man like me never learns his lesson and gets up multiple times. I'm guided by a strange fate, leading a strange army, and I head into a strange battle.

The man's eyes are as dazzling as ever, just like the time he knocked on the gate of a certain school.

"Late blooming blossoms
Have no reason to wheedle
At this point in life
Now they scatter in delight
Carried by the hometown winds. 
For I am closer
To my revered mentor
At Noyama Prison"

"Well now, I'll be heading out, my mentor."

"Fou fooou!!!"

The crane's hand grasps and lifts a plushie. The girl behind the glass window's face is grim as she watches intently. Another girl and creature watch with bated breath from the side.

Heart-racing, suspenseful tension fills the air. Something that could only be experienced in an arcade has been condensed into this single moment.

What will be the fate of this plushie?

A burly man and a girl with a double bun hairstyle face each other, with a machine between the two. A fierce battle has been unfolding for a while on-screen. Both players' HP gauges are razor thin.

The burly man executes a powerful move.

But the girl with double buns is calm. She precisely taps the buttons frame-by-frame to flawlessly block the man's attacks. And then, the next thing he knows...

←→→Ｐ＋Ｋ!

Her fingers input a perfect command and...

K.O.

The game's called. The girl raises her fist and lets out a cry of victory.

A genius who loves music also demonstrates impressive talent in music games. Delicate fingers strike the keyboard without hesitation, creating beautiful music. The lone spectator quietly listens to his unending performance, while in the background, intense music, set to drown out the beautiful melody is about to begin.

The sound of engines starting echoes in everyone's ears. The seat and the steering wheel are tools of entertainment, both designed to be simple and safe. However...

"You're too stiff, charred woman. At this rate you're going to pull the wheel right off."

"Shut your mouth! Don't patronize me! I'm gripping the wheel fine, okay!?"

Even if it's a game, the two do not cut corners. Whether it's the King of Knights who commands Riding skills or the dragon witch who desperately grips the wheel because she's a novice, they fight to win!

The race to separate the winner from the loser is close at hand.

And with that, my job is done and I close the star's light.

Along with my memories, my body quietly, slowly, and calmly returns to the abyss where it all originated. It's a very dark, very remote, and very lonely place. But I'm not sad this time. My body will remain intact without being used to create something and my memory will also remain warm and pleasant without being rejected.

This time my children were foolish, small, and vulnerable, but they are not weak by any means. They will surely prosper longer than I. As long as one continues to live, one's childhood will end. And this time I'm confident I can send them off with a smile.

Goodbye, my lovely children. Even if you leave this star, may you thrive on a different one.

Long ago, the sea sang, "Please stay with me forever." "Please never leave me."

But now, the sea sings, "Please don't come back to me again." "Please don't love me again."

The calamity is like a shooting star.

The roar of the crimson dragons. The beloved sword, Aestus Estus, was reforged by the flames of the seven dragon heads. It is the crimson of the setting sun that tints one's vision. It is the heat of blood that bubble in one's throat. It is the warmth of a fading life. It is...the flame that scorches the world.

Now, let us mourn the past. Let us loathe betrayal and lament ignorance. Let us curse the blessings that were never granted. At least this "me" will be left with the sadness of those days.

Ah...the agonizing screams that were never meant to reach so high now tear through the heavens like one's dazzling love.

Porcini, morel mushroom, chanterelle. Oh, and of course truffles. We Romans really loved mushroom dishes. Though for some reason, the Celts seemed to believe mushrooms had evil powers or something... Well, I won't deny it, since there were a good number of people who keeled over from eating poison mushrooms. But hey, with a little trial and error, we Romans learned how to distinguish the poisonous from the edible mushrooms.

Huh? Why do I call my mushroom dishes sacred food offerings? Well, you know that's just what you call a Roman Nero joke...

"My father became a god after he consumed mushrooms, you know."

HAHAHAHAHA!

This puppy growls at the moonlit night. 

A puppy that manifested along with the Heroic Spirit Sétanta. Could it be that the soul of the Hound of Culann he once killed latched on to Sétanta's soul in the Throne and miraculously manifested in miniature form? Or is this the spirit of an offspring of the legendary ferocious hound?

Sétanta himself doesn't really know.

What is clear is that this puppy doesn't actually help Sétanta in battle, nor does it share emotions and sensations like a familiar.

...And that it growls at the moonlit night.

A gentle breeze envelopes you, as it beckons the many new encounters that are sure to come. 

The season of a new story is upon us.

There was a sunset.

Not everything has been lost...it's just that things have become murky recently. Things I try to remember visually are especially hazy. Even when words can be remembered, it is difficult to form an image. It's all just too muddled.

That's why this image is so very precious; it is an image of the sunset that day...

Among the lush vines, white flowers, a gourd bears fruit...and the sun's rays paint it orange.

I remember it clearly.

In the gleam of the setting sun, my own hands then pluck the gourd...and the first human life I pruned away with my own hands.

The golden sword said to have been held by Chrysaor, the monster born from Medusa's blood. It's unclear whether the sword used by the Saber version is the real thing. Normally its golden light is hidden, just like her Mystic Eyes.

She gets upset.

"Are you seriously asking me to cut this dirty, foul-smelling thing? Unbelievable...!"

She takes great care of it.

"It needs to be pristine at all times; it should never be unsightly."

She gazes at it lovingly when no one is looking.

"Heh. This will do. You look so handsome today, as usual."

She furrows her brow at the hungry eyes of the sword afficionados.

"Hey. Don't stare at it."

And she sleeps with it.

"Zzzzzz..."

She rarely talks about the sword, but how she feels about it is no mystery.

Bhīma's favorite knife.

There is actually another, differently shaped knife, which was used for a different purpose.

When the five Pandava brothers were exiled from their kingdom after losing a bet, they were forced to spend twelve years in the forest. Then, in the thirteenth year, they were forced to live in anonymity. In the kingdom of Matsya, the brothers assumed various disguises and served King Virāṭa. Yudhiṣṭhira the eldest, assumed the role of an advisor of dice named Kanka. Arjuna, the third son, disguised himself as a eunuch named Brihannala. Nakula, the fourth son, disguised himself as an ostler and assumed the name Granthika. Sahadeva, the fifth son, tended cattle and took the name Tatripala. For his part, Bhīma decided to assume the role of Vallabha, a cook.

"Oh man, I didn't know what was gonna happen, but I got lucky. King Virāṭa suddenly assigned ME the position of head cook. That king sure had a good eye for talent! You want to know what I did all day? Obviously, I lived there, cooking all the dishes I wanted to make! My bulging muscles might've given away my talent for martial arts, but I spent all my days cooking. Well...there might've been one time when I had to, uh, tenderize a guy because he picked on my Draupadī. But I suppose you can still call that cooking, right? No?"

...Tenderize?

Durgā, who was born to destroy the demon god Mahiṣā, was given a variety of weapons by the gods. One of them was a Divine Beast, a gift from Himavat, god of the Himalayas. This Divine Beast is sometimes depicted as a lion.

Himavat's name means "one who holds snow," and he is said to be a deified personification of the Himalayan mountains. He is the father of Shiva's consort Umā, who is considered to be the same being as Pārvatī.

This Divine Beast has it all! It's fast! Strong! And cool! It's popular among children, and its fur is soft and fluffy too!

The most popular Indian Divine Beast has been crowned...or so we thought.

"But when it comes to durability and endurance, I am superior," claims Pārvatī's sacred cow, Nandi, with calm, unshakable composure.

A set of dice Śakuni entrusted to Duryodhana.

Śakuni was the younger brother of Gāndhārī, who was the consort of King Dhr̥tarāṣṭra of the Kuru kingdom, making him Duryodhana's uncle. He was always friendly with Duryodhana, and he committed various misdeeds against the Five Princes in an effort to put his nephew on the throne. He also fought on his nephew's side in the great war. Śakuni was said to be a gambling prodigy and is best known as the central figure in setting up the dice game that led to the exile of the Five Princes. However, it's unknown how "honest" this gambling game was...

"I have to say, scheming with Uncle Śakuni to absolutely crush Yudhiṣṭhira in that game of dice is definitely one of the highlights of my incredible life. The excitement, the thrill, the tension...and the look on that pathetic idiot's face make me SO happy every time I remember it all! Ah! So good!
Huh? You say it was rigged? Hey, I've read those gambling mangas you have stored in the library. The protagonist usually wins with clever tricks that border on cheating. Listen. When the protagonist does it, it's not cheating. So, even if I did cheat, since I'm clearly the protagonist, it wasn't REALLY cheating! Don't you forget it!"

Hearing that, you vow to yourself that you will never, ever gamble with that person.

This is a Holy Grail War covered in lies.

A missing Servant class...
Impossible Servant summonings...
A nation shrouded in secrecy...
And a city created as a battleground.

In the face of such irregularities, the Holy Grail War is twisted and driven into the depths of madness.

Let the curtain rise on a masquerade of humans and heroes, made to dance upon a stage of a false Holy Grail.

A wax tablet and stylus, used in ancient times as writing materials. Ptolemaîos would go on to treasure the wax tablet and stylus he received in school at Mieza for the remainder of his life. 

Neither particularly extravagant nor imbued with Mystics, these are simple, practical tools. And that is why, from his conquests in the East to his time as pharaoh of Egypt, they gave him solace...for while he may never be able to return to those halcyon days, these simple tools always brought those times to mind.

Yeah, it's thanks to this thread that I survived. Threads weave fate together. But there's one thing to remember: this thread is used to visualize the fates between people. That there is no conceptual red thread between two people doesn't mean there's no connection.

Had I followed this thread more closely, my life might have been an easier one. But, I still want to continue to cherish connections I can't see, or even those which may not exist.

All that is why you should also be careful when you use it, Master. That said... you've stayed by my side all this time. I trust you completely.

Yeah, it's just a tool. As long as I can shoot, that's all that matters... At least, that's the sentiment that'd have made things simple, but the truth is that even a simple tool is still important. It should sit well in my hand and it should put the bullet exactly where I want it to go without ever missing. I've been using this thing for so long, I can do it with my eyes closed.

Well, having said that, I got a feeling I'd switch to a new gun if I found one that was newer and better, because at the end of the day, protecting you is more important than anything else. At least that's what it means to be a Servant.

The 4th year of the Keian Era, Edo Period.
It has been several decades since the end of a turbulent, blood-soaked era.
People were enjoying peace and tranquility.
But, a battle between seven pairs of Masters and Servants is about to begin,
as the "Waxing Moon Ritual" unfolds in the shadows.
Miyamoto Iori, a young man in Asakusa, finds himself caught in the violence of a Holy Grail War.

Mission complete! Good work!

After a brief respite, everyone has gathered to enjoy a bit of fun. The main event, the moment everyone's been waiting for: the new Director's specially made...

...Hm. What is that? Is that meat?

You've lost me, but it's probably delicious!

Let's enjoy the many festivals around the world together!

And so, my summer adventure is over.

The good times may have flown by, but the memories still remain as photos.

Shopping with friends I thought I would never meet again... Socializing with a friendly rival... Hanging out with new friends... The relaxed expressions of acquaintances who typically don't show their feelings outwardly...

And...

The memory of running wildly along the shores of a summer beach that seemed to stretch on forever...alongside someone who holds a special place in my heart.

Even if this "me" only existed this summer, the blue sky will sparkle in my memory for all time.

Summer is melting into the sunset. I didn't want that to happen, so we hit the road to chase the setting sun.

"See? If we chase it down, this moment—and summer—will last forever!"

But then the sun finally sinks below the horizon, we both look at each other and laugh at the inevitable. This moment, though, is exactly what makes this time so precious. One day, summer will end. That's why it's important to really enjoy every moment of it. You don't try to stop it from ending; you enjoy it because you know eventually it will. Once we have both agreed and acknowledged that immutable fact, we go full throttle and slice through the waves.

"Did you give it your all? No regrets? Good for you! Suuuper jelly! Spending your summer like that is the best part of your youth! You couldn't do everything because there was too much you wanted to do? But you gave it your all, right? Then that's okay. Those memories are priceless summer treasures! Got it!?" 

　　　　　　　　　　◆

As the rain stops, Suzuka thinks back as she stands in the moonlit garden with cherry blossoms dancing in the air.

"You don't do it to prevent it from ending, but because eventually it has to."

That's what it means to live. She acknowledges it, and then takes her love's hand.

That's why she dashes through the present.

If I recall correctly, it was the day before the deadline.

I may have been exhausted from crunch time, but my psyche was, on the contrary, clear. It felt as if time was being infinitely compressed. The feeling of fatigue was soon replaced by a sense of omnipotence, and it felt like I could do anything!

...Yep, that's the so-called crunch time high.

The next thing I knew, we were in the pool at night. Uh, we were definitely not in any position to be playing around, not when every single second is so precious. But the two of us sneaked out of the room. We even turned off our phones.

That night, when we just played in the water for no reason...was really, really fun.

After peace was restored to the island, a remorseful Morgan loosened the restrictions on participation and expanded the scale of the Earthman Race. The race was perfect for the final day in Hawaltria, and the winner was given a trophy along with their "desired item."

"I desired this house. I couldn't care less about the trophy. I wanted a pretty vacation home with a pool where I could spend time with Master, so I just took the entire beach♡"

The winner smiles mischievously. The trophy that's been placed next to the window bears in inscription which reads:

"This glory is for my fated person."

The dragon did not demonstrate her strength simply for her own sake...

"To protect animals weaker than yourself...that is the duty of those who were born strong."

They may not have been born strong, but Master submitted an application to join the organization to support the group's leader, who as working to protect the forest, in accordance with that mantra. The next day, a new uniform designed for a human was issued, along with some extra equipment no other members had.

"What's this hat?"

"You need to protect your head from the sun. It's the same design as mine. It's only fitting that you wear one, since you're going to be assisting me."

"I see. We need to match to show we're a team."

"That is not why! I only chose it because I wanted to prioritize defense!"

Seeing the leader of the group explaining in a panic, Master regretted not joining the group earlier. Well, they'll make it up for it...

"But it might not fit."

The hat is so large, it needs to be held with both hands. It'll definitely need to be tailored to fit properly.

The faerie affected by the summer festival willingly took up the pen, even though she knew she was neither capable nor qualified to do so.

"I'm going to write what's happened in a book, then realize its contents as a type of magecraft."

That was how the high queen of Faerie Britain's magecraft worked. This is how the very first Mystics were established...something the mages of Proper Human History have long since forgotten. It's amazing. However, she did not do this to imitate her beloved monarch.

Camelot, the city in Faerie Britain where she used to live. From the moment she saw the portrait buried deep in the castle's library, she dreamed about it, wanting so much to give it shape, even if it may not turn out so well. Under the starry sky, in a mansion no one visited, she quietly wrote the book as she reflected on her precious memories.

And then she finally completed the book.

"The title will be...hmmm, yes, it has to be this."

It is not recorded in the era of the high queen, but is instead a collection of fairy tales said to have happened in the Fae era.

These are the stories a witch experienced by herself, yet who was not her.

Um, ahem. I'm only going to say this once, so eyes on me while you listen to my oath.

"I, Cnoc na Riabh of the King Clan, do hereby recognize your sincerity and loyalty, and do most affectionately award you with a well-deserved boon reflecting these qualities. As I pledge to you a lifelong friendship and love that will never wither, I place this tiara—a symbol of my heart—upon your head."

What do you think? Pretty, right? Thank you for always believing in the faerie me. From the bottom of my heart, I appreciate that you never doubted me in the slightest, both when I was doing well in battle and when I was on the verge of annihilation. I knew, I guess from my previous life...well, my time in Faerie Britain would count as my previous life, so you and I have had a connection since then...or rather, I always had my eye on you...like, it was love at first sight and all...

Anyway! We've gotten this close, so you just have to accept the tiara. Hm? Why the hesitation? It may be a tiara, but it's like a marriage ring, so it shouldn't have too much...

"Huh? It's physically heavy? Like, big? Of course it is, since it's the great faerie's tiara. I couldn't bring the tiara from Faerie Britain, so you'll have to make do with this one, my Master♡"

A luxury hotel built overnight on a tropical island. The queen's own retreat, built by her own hands, exclusively for her use...and that of her companions.

From the outside, the hotel looks like a palace on a hill, on the other side is a private beach. At the front entrance is an atrium, and since there's no wall on the beach side, visitors are treated to an expansive view of the tropical sea the moment they step into the building. The beauty and openness of the place transports them to a world apart from everyday life. 

Each of the hotel's rooms has an ocean view. It also boasts a five-star restaurant. Other amenities include a state of the art gym, a golf course, and even a go-kart track. This place is a paradise beyond paradise. The hotel and all it has to offer are the result of Morgan's sense of beauty, pride, and appreciation for her partner.

"Though it will disappear with summer, I hope the time spent here in paradise will remain forever in your memory."

　　　◆

That aside...the guardian of the sacred sword wondered whether the queen was embarrassed to use magical energy resources she stored with the intent of revitalizing the country for something so personal, but the queen immediately responded, "It was a necessary national expense."

A transparent helmet-shaped object Wandjina wears. It's actually a Noble Phantasm.

It's a continuously active Noble Phantasm that combines the concept of water and rain found in the atmosphere. Wandjina refers to this as a "droplet." Should an ordinary put it on, it will drench them. Surprisingly, however, they will not drown. As Wandjina is a spirit that blesses life, this equipment will not harm anyone, even should they touch it. Rather, they are invigorated, their life force revitalized.

But be warned: this droplet is a Noble Phantasm that is one or two steps away from an Authority. Should one try to take it from Wandjina, there will be trouble. Even if Wandjina doesn't get angry, there's a strong chance the other spirits, fairies, or even Divine Spirits would grow truly enraged.

Which is why, even if you see it just lying around, handle it with care!

Ritsuka Fujimaru is humanity's last Master. Restoring humanity would have been impossible without him. However, even he has a shortcoming: he is honest to a fault! This FGO slapstick anime shows Fujimaru's naive questions throwing the Heroic Spirits into a turmoil!

An illusion seen by a man haunted by justice.

The lanterns that decorate the area below Castle Csejte.

A terrifying demoness who appears each night in your dreams...

To my beloved, blessings on this holy night.

The de-facto headquarters of the Mage's Association, a major power in the world of magecraft.
Many famed mages acquired their knowledge behind its walls, however, behind the glory of its long-standing history, darkness lurks in the shadows.

A type of magecraft that processes, makes use of, and commands the dead.

"Even if this life ends without any achievement, its death will not be wasted."
The man says as if mocking himself.
