Each mouthful recalls memories of summer. Apparently, the syrup is "Blue Luluhawa," an identical-tasting variant of Blue Hawaiian.

A gift from Ibuki-Douji (Berserker).

The box and glass are filled to the brim with sweet, fragrant sake. This is unquestionably junmai daiginjou of the highest grade, and its rich sweetness is apparently a unique, original brew.

Enjoy it with the accompanying bite-sized framboise chocolate.

...Once you're an adult, that is.

Valentine's Day chocolate from Lady Avalon.

This bouquet of flowers is made from brilliantly colored chocolates. So pretty...and glaringly bright! A closer look reveals that they are literally glittering. A photometer confirms this.

So, uh...why...is the chocolate sparkly?

Valentine's Day chocolate from Ortlinde (Assassin) and Irs.

A large chocolate dumped on a Divine Iron Shield-shaped plate. It's huge. It appears to be modeled after the mortar shells (officially named Sowilo missiles) that the Valkyries fire in combat.

You can't exactly call it cute...so they decorated it with a hibiscus.

Valentine's Day chocolate from Thrúd (Assassin) and Rindr.

Cartridge-shaped chocolates, casings included, are piled on a Divine Iron Shield-shaped plate. Each is carefully wrapped in gold foil. They appear to be modeled on the submachine gun ammunition the Valkyries use in combat.

One chocolate is unwrapped, as if to demonstrate that this isn't live ammunition... Thrúd was afraid they were so well-made, you might not notice otherwise.

Valentine's Day chocolate from Hildr (Assassin) and Rún.

Hand grenade-shaped chocolates strewn on a Divine Iron Shield-shaped plate. While you've never seen the Valkyries use these in combat, they are part of the standard loadout in this Spirit Origin.

It appears the duo had a small spat over whether to decorate them with cute ribbons.

A gift from Gareth (Saber).

Icy cold sports drinks in plastic bottles. It's not summer without one of these! Perfect not just for hydration, but warding off the heat, too!

This is Gareth's secret trick to surviving a heat wave. It might be a little too cold for February, but never mind that! It's the thought that counts!

Valentine's Day chocolate from Wu Zetian (Caster).

Glutinous rice is said to have evil-warding properties and these handy cakes' cost-performance ratio is second to none; throw them at a jiangshi zombie to deal damage, force-feed one to explode it from the inside out, or apply as a poultice to a bite victim's wounds to absorb the venom. 

It's important to be environmentally conscious these days, however, so Wu Zetian makes sure to clean up after herself. Whether it's Hassan picking up his dirks or the Torturers cleaning up the sticky rice, all are exemplars of Chaldea's culture of thriftiness.

"So it's not like I gave you these for any particular reason... I'm just all about 'reduce, reuse, recycle!'"

It's unclear how exactly one is supposed to recycle sticky rice, but the cakes' delectable flavor and texture are beyond question.

All that's left is to pray that you don't become a jiangshi yourself.

Valentine's Day doughnuts from Erice Utsumi (Avenger).

A prize for passing an archaeology pop quiz, rewarding her Master's excellent score. Erice pored over a dessert cookbook while making these. She insists that this is a perfectly valid Valentine's Day gift, since it includes chocolate-frosted doughnuts.

"I'm sure you can tell... I think it's clear enough... The motif is stars and planets. And a life preserver, obviously. Oh, I'm really proud of this one, though the jelly filling spilled out a little. Voyager discovered volcanic activity on a type of satellite during a flyby. That's why I tried to make the frosting look like lava. Yeah."

Valentine's Day chocolate from Komahime, with a light refreshment from Sen-no-Rikyu.

Apparently, Komahime was fed up with afternoon tea consisting entirely of matcha and forced Sen-no-Rikyu to switch Spirit Origins with her. Her matcha-brewing skills—which may or may not involve copious amounts of milk—left Sen-no-Rikyu in disapproving astonishment. The result is an expertly crafted matcha chocolate latte. The baked chocolate biscuits to the side make for a simple but comforting accompaniment.

On this Valentine's Day, let us savor each other's hospitality. Live in this moment, like a flower blooming in the wild.

Valentine's Day chocolate from Iyo.

These acorn-shaped chocolates are rather elaborately made, with cupules consisting of ground acorns Iyo foraged from the forest. Having never attempted anything quite this girly before, Iyo cheerfully threw herself at the challenge and produced this gem of a confection. Also, their flavor is quite simple and addictive, so it's easy to eat several before you realize it.

A girl put all her heart into this treat, never imagining how wonderful the result would be.

Valentine's Day return gift from Yamanami Keisuke.

While these appear to be Yamanami's personal possessions, in truth they're merely a common pen and inkstone rather than an artisanal stationary set. There is an oddly elegant air to them.

Under the warm sunlight, listening to the wind caress my cheeks, I calmly put pen to paper. You've reminded me how precious such commonplace moments are.

I scatter, fleeting and beautiful, with the petals of a mountain cherry blossom.

Valentine's Day chocolate from Huyan Zhuo.

These finely-made chocolates were clearly crafted with plenty of joy. Their flavor is first-rate, and they are more than satisfactory as a gift.

But before Huyan Zhuo handed them over, she committed the grave error of whispering roughly into her Master's ear. Her criminal actions were digitally recorded. The device next to the chocolates is made to exclusively replay Huyan Zhuo's voice.
Apollo('s plush doll) captured her shame in its full, lossless glory.

It appears Huyan Zhuo’s shrill scream combined with an unabashed request was made: “If you’re going to include this as a Valentine, then please whisper something in MY ear too!”
An agreement was struck in which both parties agreed to keep this a secret. Of course, Apollo('s plush doll) knows it all.

It is only a matter of time before Kiyohime learns of this.

Valentine's Day chocolate from Elisa the Nine-Tattooed Dragon.

Elisa came up with the idea of crayon chocolates, Boudica made them, and Goredolf cast an insect-repellent spell. (Edison also took them for mass-production.) They still taste like chocolate, albeit with a shelf life of about 2,000 years.

Elisa packed every person she could think of into her drawing, but it still looks like she ran out of room. Apparently, she wanted to include 108 people.

"Take good care of it, Leader!"

You wanted to frame and hang it but she shot down that idea out of embarrassment.

A return gift from Huang Feihu.

This cloak resembles the one he wears. It isn't particularly extravagant but a practiced eye will appreciate the beauty of its craftmanship.

It is a distinctly practical garment and has the Huang warrior's personal seal of approval. Boasting excellent resistance to blades, fire, and blunt trauma, a trained wearer can even use it to ward off arrows and thrown projectiles. Noble Phantasms...might be a challenge...but nonetheless, it's a precious mantle you ought to don on the battlefield.

It is said the fine details will be instantly recognizable to anyone connected to the Huang family. Wear it in certain areas, and you'll be received with warm hospitality.

Valentine's Day chocolate from Britomart.

Britomart created this plate with Faerie Britain in mind. The castle and people have been recreated with vividly colored chocolates and cookies.

It was also most definitely not baked in a single night.

Studying under the kitchen Heroic Spirits, Britomart practiced every day until she managed something she was satisfied with.

A return gift from Father Kotomine.

This small antique wristwatch is of a unisex design. Although undamaged, the hands don't move. They stopped on that fateful day in 2017.

When it eventually begins to tick again...what will you have lost and what will you have gained? And...what will you have seen?

Valentine's Day chocolate from Nitocris (Alter).

Surrounding the dish
are Medjeds
and a noble hound.

Nitocris Alter made a chocolate in the shape of a single feather. It is unknown why these individuals have sought it out. The dog appears to be a Divided Spirit of Anubis but it declines to explain itself.

Now...
It is time...
...to test your courage.

Valentine's Day chocolate from Kukulcan.

A smooth, palm-sized, spherical chocolate. It seems to be the core of a spaceship. Anyway, Kukulcan compressed cacao into this sphere. Its density can't be replicated while on Earth. This means it is completely inedible. Perhaps you can try it on a special occasion. There are also four dinosaur-shaped chocolates on the sides. (Mash helped.)

It does have functions beyond simply serving as a chocolate treat, but rest assured they won't activate unless Kukulcan is present.

Valentine's Day chocolate from Tenochtitlan.

These are keys to the cockpit of the city-type engine robot, Tenochtitlan. You could call them master keys. One is a silver, hummingbird-shaped key, while the other is a chocolate modeled after it.

Later, the self-styled Divine Spirit was witnessed soliciting her Master on their way back to their quarters after simulator training. 

"You're going the wrong way. You'd get better quality rest in my room...don't you think?"

A return gift from Tezcatlipoca.

The luxurious glass is filled not with alcohol, but thick hot chocolate. Its exquisite sweetness washes away your fatigue, its complex bitterness keeps you wanting more, and it brims with power that restores your will to fight for hope and the future.

"A drink like this is right for you. You can wash away your anxiety and fear with liquor once you're older."

While his appearance and behavior may be frightening, his concern and guiding principles are nothing less than godly.

Valentine's Day chocolate from Johanna.

This bright, decadent chocolate features banana and other fruits. For some reason, Johanna seems to glow when you eat it. "That's the kind of miracle it is," according to her.

The eater doesn't radiate light; instead, you become convinced Johanna is glowing. However, it isn't as if the radiance compels you or makes you want to obey her. While Johanna was very excited to make this dessert, she realized that there could be unwelcome consequences if other Servants were to eat it, and resigned herself to finishing the whole plate with her Master.

Also, when Johanna eats the chocolate herself, she doesn't glow; instead, her Master glows in her eyes.

A Valentine's Day gift from Mash.

The charming shapes feel somehow warm and nostalgic. These handmade cream puffs, filled with kindness, seem to bring solace to your constantly beleaguered heart.

Mash says that she struggled to make the choux pastries turn out right, but you can't imagine how that could be after seeing the end result. The flaky shells are generously packed with fresh cream and delicately garnished with chocolate, making it a perfect Valentine's Day treat to enjoy together.

Doujin published by Chaldea Gamers.

It is a collaboration by Chaldean Servants who play video games. Actually, it is the very first issue created by a club that was thrown together by the handful of people who just happened to be around when Tomoe Gozen was suddenly inspired to form a club for ServantFes. 

The very first issue is a collection of general interest under the topic of "games themed after Altria," including "Spirits 'n Skellies," "The Game of Can You Make It in Life," and "Altriacraft." Its contents are diverse and include reviews, fan art, four-panel cartoons, diaries, strategies, screenshots, etc.

The second doujin issue by Chaldea Gamers.

It is a collaboration by Chaldean Servants who play video games. In this issue, topics include:
"The Top Ten Blood-Soaked Dating Sims,"
"Introduction to VR Chambara,"
"Altriacraft Picture Diaries, Part Two,"
"Warrior Maiden Illustration Column: Altria Craft,"
"The Genpei Idol Legend -Determination and Uprising, a Novella,"
"The Young Noble's Melancholy, a Novella."

...And much more. This issue is chock-full of content, just like the first!

An Altria-is-the-heroine-in-all-the-rom-com-stories doujin book created by the collective efforts of a club called Yoroshiku Mount Liang.

The moment the heroine meets and falls in love with her crush takes all of two or three pages, after which point the story develops at a breakneck pace with special shortcuts, making the stories a truly fast rom-com. And of course, the number of people who feature is staggering. Just unbelievable. It's Mount Liang, after all. There's one 108 of them!

The names of the characters are of course all Altria, and so fans of the book were heard saying things like, "I like the tsundere Altria," or "I like the amorphous Altria," to differentiate them.

A doujin written by the leader of club Yoroshiku Mount Liang, Huyan Zhuo, who insisted on the book's creation.

Its main character? Huyan Zhuo herself! It's her dream manga, rather than a story of her dreams. On top of that, it's a rom-com. In a way, it's the ultimate title one would want to forget or pretend never existed. There're even a few raunchy scenes, so the embarrassment level increases threefold.

She claims there is no specific model for the person with whom the protagonist falls in love, but of course this is not true. There's definitely, and very obviously, a model. While the doujin was being drawn, she though no one would ever notice. Afterward, she was astonished to realize there was in fact no way they would NOT notice!

If they realized but never said anything, they're mean. If they haven't realized, they're just dense.

Oh, but...maybe I actually enjoy this vague state. And if so, I sincerely wish it will go on forever.

As a side not, this title was kind of a spur-of-the-moment thing, so there is no actual iron whip in the work.

He's a little rough around the edges, but Al is an energetic boy who wears short pants even in winter, and Altie is an active and cheerful girl who is a little interested in him. This is an adorable, yet educational health awareness manga that centers one these two, as the story follows them in their every day lives! There's even a mysterious mascot whose smile is a bit suspicious and a health professor who answers the characters' health and medical questions in easy-to-understand ways, as well as teaching the readers useful medical tidbits! 

Although it appears to be aimed at children, the health knowledge depicted is accurate and practical, making this a book anyone could benefit from reading.

The first draft of the book notes that there is a bonus booklet included with the doujin called the Altria Conversion Table, but for some reason, the wording was removed from the actual published book cover and the conversion table is blacked out. However, if readers follow the fine print and try to call the contact information written on the back, someone with a blunt, doctoral tone will not hesitate to tell you the conversion value without any problem.

"Ultimately, it doesn't matter how the information is relayed as long as the correct data is shared some way or another...right?"

According to a certain rumor...somewhere in this world, there's a remarkable underground doctor who never stays in one place, but continues to travel hither and yon. If someone living in the west has a strange cough, he purses his lips and says, “I've never heard it sound like that before."  If someone living in the east gets their arm caught in a rock in an accident, he approaches and says, “I've never seen it bend at such an angle." If he seems happy when encountering these things, that's probably just your imagination.

Through the latest medical technology that is constantly being updated, along with the chiseled body hidden beneath his white coat thanks to the ancient Greek fighting art, Pankration, the man continues to face his patients to fulfill his calling as a doctor rather than for money or praise. His name...

A super doctor...Doctor A!

～A Club Bishonen Production: "Ex Bean Paste Photo Collection"～

The very first photobook of Ex, also known as Mysterious Idol X (Alter). She is lovely, like sakura mochi and refreshing like minazuki, the triangular sweet rice jelly topped with red bean paste. The rainbow confectionaries that add color to the seasons are sure to please your tastebuds as much as your eyes♪

"To learn the heart of Japanese confectionaries...I must become bean paste myself!"

The Japanese confectionary (cosplay) included are:
Sakura mochi, minazuki, kohakutou, konpeito, mikasa, aruheitou, mizu manjyu, mizu yokan, hishimochi, monaka, nerikiri, etc.

～A Club Bishonen Production: "Kensesetsu Bishonenroku"～

"Kinsesetsu Bishonenroku (A Modern-Day Record of Bishonen)" was the incomplete yomi-hon penned by novelist Kyokuutei Bakin during their late years. And now, a short film in which the Eight Dog Warriors magnificently recreate a selection of scenes, is available. What fate will the two good-looking main characters, Akenosuke and Morishirou, meet!?

The voice-over by some of Chaldea's greatest is a must-listen, too!
(In full color! Duration: 38 minutes)

Performer/Voice-Over
Sue Akenosuke Harukata
Shino  [Sigurd]

Ooe-no-Morishirou Narikatsu
Shinbei [Takasugi Shinsaku]

Hitaka Kageichi 
Sousuke [Leonidas I]

Minehari Nanarokurou Michiyoshi  
Genpachi [Xiang Yu]

Kokane
Keno [Red Hare]

Abo-no-Yagorou Naoyuki
Daikaku [Oberon]

Jyusanya Kushirou
Dousetsu [Zhang Jue]

Kuwatsuyu/Kanakuso Kajirou 
Kobungo [Columbus]

Mordred, the rebellious idol from Chaldea Productions entertainment agency. Ever since they sold out the Camlann Super Arena for their debut concert, their momentum has been unstoppable! And so the release of their first photo collection book, "Phantasma" is at hand! In the book, shots of Mordred, from training school days to the present, follow their miraculous journey and are collected into this single book. Brave, yet delicate. Strong, yet fragile.

―――Charging ahead―――
Ah, you are a shooting star = étoile filante
Ah, you are a flash of light = éclair
The present, which has been captured, is already a distant past.
Quo vadis?
Even when the distant days that will one day disappear come, you will surely continue to smile...
(Excerpt from "Chaldea Weekly"/Written by Crane Woman)

...And so a “fictitious idol photo collection” was created. Powerful hallucinations of Mo turning into an idol have finally led to the creation of a doujin. And obviously the setting is what everyone imagines it to be. But the book left Miss Crane completely impressionable, and now she's in too deep. The book now has become so elaborate, it comes with patterns for all the outfits along with tailoring instructions. With this, you too can mimic Mo's style!

In the Abominable God Killer Era, the Goddamn Year 99999...

Over a thousand centuries have passed since London lost its light. The moon has devoured the sun, madness preys on reason, and the world is truly shrouded in perpetual darkness. A dark eon indeed. Humanity, or humans, now exist only as miserable livestock kept by the evil spirits, the demons. But one man, carrying a sacred gun, steps out from the shadows.

Vlad III! O humans, praise the name!

He is humanity's final exorcist gunner, a deus exo, wielding a giant cross-shaped rifle purification armament, the Kazikli Bey. He faces the evil spirit prince, Doomsguy Mordred, who was born to Cassandra Weep, the child of the dreaded prophecy, through the forbidden human-demon cross breeding method known as demonosynthesis.

When their fates collide, the eternal darkness will die and usher in morning. This techno-futile occult Victorian gothic gun action story begins now!
(Excerpt from text found in the fourth chart in the doujin.)

This is a picture novel-style doujin penned by James Moriarty. It features rich, engaging photography. Tis deluxe cosplay photo book centers on Vlad III and Mordred, along with other Servants happily participating in the photo shoot. The book captures real superhuman action from the performers, and of course it comes with a bonus book with patterns for the costumers.

After the photo shoot, there were some Servants who asked if they could keep going and just film a movie.

"A new breath of summer arrives in Faerie Britain..."

The protagonist, came on a whim from Japan to England as an exchange student, got on the wrong bus and ended up in Faerie Britain. Everywhere they look is a scene right from a fantasy novel! Everybody they meet has a secret!

There's the Child of Prophecy who has kicked her mission to the curb and is all but overflowing with dreams. She is in the middle of a journey of prayer along with Princess Mash, who reincarnated in Faerie Britain, and a knight who's helping the princess find the faerie Holy Grail. There's even a villainess who was chased from her castle and the head maid who takes care of her. An Albion picture book chock-full of scientific manga. There's an evil queen who reigns by turning seawater into chocolate, and Totorot in a bold swimsuit, striving to foil her ambitions. And finally, a kind witch wearing a pointy hat who manages to solve everyone's problems as she travels the world.

The protagonist is full of hopeful wishes, but doesn't know right from left in this land...

We hope you will enjoy the protagonist's many adventures!

This is a creative mural of a summer that memorialized the "moment." It's is the ultimate memento of a dream that combined the laughter, tears, ambition, hard work, and trouble of all the warriors who gathered here on this land.

Summer may end, but...

The fun moments...
The hard moments...
The laughter...
The sense of competition...

May you never forget any of those feelings.

"Okay, see you next time! Good work, everyone!!!"

One of the gods who created the world in Mesopotamian myth. The gods were born from Abzu (fresh water) and Tiamat (salt water).
Afterward, the gods rebelled against their father, Abzu, and gained control of the world.
When this happened, Tiamat kindly watched over her children. This was proof that her love for her children exceeded her love for their father.

However, the gods eventually turned their blades on even Tiamat. She mourned and went mad, and created the monstrous Eleven Offspring of Tiamat to battle the gods.
At the end of the battle, Tiamat and her Eleven Offspring lost.
The gods split her corpse in two to make the heavens and the earth. This is said to be the ritual that created the human world.

condMessage: Unlock after clearing "Star of the Beginning, We Look Up at the Sky"
comment:
Height/Weight: 160cm – 7,400,000km2 ?? kg
Origin: Ancient Mesopotamian Mythology
Region: Mesopotamia
Alignment: Chaotic-Evil
Sub-Attribute: Beast
Gender: Female
The black mud’s dimensions should be included in Tiamat’s own. But since the mud is of the void element, it cannot be weighed. At the same time, its internal capacity is infinite. It’s essentially a four-dimensional pocket space.

condMessage: Unlock after clearing "Star of the Beginning, We Look Up at the Sky"
comment:
A womb abandoned after the creation of the world.
The "Primordial Sea" that was used as the fertile soil which created life, but when Earth's environment settled down and ecosystems were established, she was banished to the world of void space (the world on the other side, a world of the void without life that isn't even a parallel world).

...Since she created life at random, now that ecosystems exist, she is no longer needed. As life on this planet began the process of gaining sentience, she could only hinder things. Ever since her banishment, Tiamat waited in the world of the void for a chance to return to Earth.

condMessage: Unlock after clearing "Star of the Beginning, We Look Up at the Sky"
comment:
"Class Skills"

Authority of Beasts: A
Also called an "anti-humanity" skill.  She gains a special attack bonus against anything born from a womb, be it Heroic or Divine Spirit. This skill is given not only to Beast II, but to all the monsters she creates as well.

Self-Manifestation: B
A skill that allows one to manifest in the world without outside help.
Once she manifests, she spends seven days taking over the Indian Ocean. She continues making monsters from the moment of her manifestation to devour humanity.
At the same time, Beast II herself is the sea, so she cannot come on land.
Exterminating humanity is the job of her children, the monsters.
Also, since this skill indicates that she exists across all of space-time, it can cancel out any attacks that use time travel or time paradoxes, as well as any instant death attacks.

Self-Modification: EX
She can use the Chaos Tide to modify her own Spirit Origin.
She can switch from her normal Spirit Origin (Femme Fatale) to a massive dragon over sixty meters tall.  In her dragon form, Tiamat nullifies any attacks below A++ rank.

condMessage: Unlock after clearing "Star of the Beginning, We Look Up at the Sky"
comment:
Primordial Sea: EX
Beast II is the sea that brings forth life itself.
Since it circulates with true ether from the time of the planet's creation, an infinite supply of magical energy is available within it.
Anyone who is trapped within the black mud and sinks into the sea is randomly given skills such as Self-Modification, Bio-Alteration, Bio-Fusion, and Replication. When they return from the sea to the land they are forced to receive a geas from Beast II at the cellular level... a DNA contract (Amino Geas), and automatically become an enemy of humanity.

Nega-Genesis: A
The same type of skill as Beast VI's Nega-Messiah.

A conceptual barrier that overturns everything modern science thinks it knows about the Theory of Evolution and the creation of the Earth. When Beast II is protected by this skill, she gains a powerful resistance to any Noble Phantasms wielded by Servants from humanity's proper history.

Monstrous Strength: A++
Her ability as a monster. Increases her strength.
Close to the highest rank. With the black mud and dragon body she uses in this manifestation, Tiamat has the strength of a giant.

condMessage: Unlock after clearing "Star of the Beginning, We Look Up at the Sky"
comment:
Tiamat returned to the world after the collapse of the Foundation of Humanity, and with the power of the Grail. However, she was in a deep sleep.
This was due to Merlin's spell, but even so, Chaldea's attack awakened her and caused her to instinctively attempt to wipe out humanity.

Part of this was due to her rage, hatred, and sorrow at being abandoned once she was no longer useful. But it was also an attempt to feel the joy that would come if she were to recreate Earth's ecosystems and once again become the mother of all things.

This nature was what decided her Class.
Her True Name is not "The Goddess of Creation."
She is a great disaster, the most rejected being in all of human history, and something that humanity long ago left behind.

Her name is Beast II.
One of the Seven Evils of Humanity, and a beast which possesses the law of Recurrence.

condMessage: Unlock after clearing "Star of the Beginning, We Look Up at the Sky"
comment:
It is impossible to confirm any sign of personality within her.
Perhaps she's lost her ideals, or perhaps she never had any reason to begin with. It could be either.
Her sole reason for existence is to bear and raise children, and then love them. But when this was taken from her, she began a war against a humanity that decided she was no longer needed.
Her internal systems run off a very primitive principle: if she does not exterminate humanity, she will be killed.

Motive/Behavior Towards Master
One of 7.2 billion. A target for annihilation.
To humanity, Beast II is a terrible invader.
But at the same time, to Beast II, humanity is a terrifying invader.

72 demon gods, assembled as one.
After King Solomon's death, the 72 demons who were sealed within his corpse awoke to a unique ideology, took Solomon's name for themselves, and set about on their task to convert the entire human race to energy. From their perspective, they became the true Mage King Solomon. 

The 72 demon gods were originally a system created by the human Solomon, the founder of magecraft, to "efficiently advance reason in the correct direction."
They came to resent the relationship between King Solomon and humans, and became a curse that attempted to overcome the "human imperfection" that Solomon had ignored for so long.

Its name is Goetia, the system for the Incineration of Humanity.
A sentient magecraft woven to reach true wisdom, and to use all of human history to reach the beginning of all.

『Ars Almadel Salomonis』
Rank: EX 
NP Type: Anti-Personnel
The Time of Birth Hath Come, I Am the Remedy of Eternity.
The Third Noble Phantasm. Original Sin I. The bands of light that foretell the end of humanity. It is a conversion of human history into heat energy, and by gathering up billions of these bands of light and then accelerating and converging them, it becomes possible to travel back in time over an incredible distance.

A Beast who calls himself the King of Demon Gods.
He possesses a sense of omnipotence which commands all the laws of the earth and the heavens, and holds a hatred so great it is as if he despises all of mankind. He wears ten rings, one on each of his fingers, but the left middle ring is a replica.

As King Solomon is his base, he had a terrifying but logical personality.
However, since he is an amalgamation of the 72 Demon Gods, he also has 72 personalities and natures. He is both one and a colony, and so when he talks with others, the Demon God most similar to that person appears on the surface. This is why Goetia's disposition has been described as a mirror.

He is the omnipotent being that even Solomon could not become. He was more than capable of becoming a king that could rule over man. But because of his omnipotence, he could not understand human nature, and because he was immortal he was not able to reach an answer. Thus, he was never able to become the "king of man."

Summoning: EX
Magecraft where spirits from the past or from the future are evoked.  
After King Solomon's death, the concepts called the 72 Demon Gods which were left behind dwelled inside King Solomon's corpse. After a long time, something wearing King Solomon's skin was born. 
Though this skill cannot be used to summon normal familiars or Heroic Spirits, he is able to summon any of the 72 demons at will. It is easier to understand him as a generator that projects the "fictional demon gods" that had nested inside King Solomon's inner world to the outsider world.

Revelation: -
A skill that makes one capable of hearing the voice of Heaven and take the most appropriate action accordingly.
As this is a skill within the soul, Goetia, who nests inside King Solomon's corpse, cannot use it.

Clairvoyance: EX
As clairvoyance is a skill retained by the body, Goetia is able to use it.

Goetia's goal is to reach the apex...
To become the only existence on this planet.
Solomon knew of man's ugliness and how they were beyond salvation, but he accepted death rather than correct it.
But the Demon Gods did not agree with him. They decided that there was no value in man and the future, and feared annihilation.
They not only hated the idea of their own annihilation, but also of the annihilation of everything.

And thus, Goetia resumed activity by nesting within King Solomon's corpse, but they quickly ran into a major dilemma. 

They had declared that man was worthless, but as Demon Gods, they could not exist without serving man. They were humiliated to find that despite being a higher-dimensional life form, they had to place themselves below man, the universe's most wholly obsolete creatures.
This contradiction and torment did not sit well with Goetia, who thus embarked on a self-revolution.

Their aim: Resetting the objective of serving mankind, to have absolute proof that they are the greatest being on the planet, to reach the apex that Solomon could never reach.
In other words, they began their great quest to achieve godhood.

And thus began Goetia's plot, the thing which called itself Solomon, the King of Mages. He created the Holy Grails as Singularities to destroy the course of history, and the mages he designated as his descendants (who could transform into Demon Gods at Goetia's command) scattered throughout history to create seven detonation points. 
This was the cause of the collapse of the Foundation of Humanity in each era.  
Once the plot was realized, human history beyond the year 2018 vanished.

It was only after these achievements that his Class was determined.
"Grand Caster" was only a false rank.
He was created by man. A great catastrophe that effectively abused human history.

His name is Beast I.
He is one of the Seven Evils of Humanity, and the Beast that possesses the principle of "pity."
The arrogance of man taking pity on another and becoming disappointed.
Such is the bestial nature of Goetia.

A man who lived between 1011 and 931 B.C..  
The third king of ancient Israel.
The land flourished the most under his rule.
He commanded 72 demons, and was the king who built the Temple of Israel.
He was known for his wise policies as a ruler, but there are also many stories of his strength as a mage.

Solomon married the daughter of Egypt's pharaoh, but one night God appeared in his dream and said, "You are worthy, so ask and you shall receive."
Solomon wished for wisdom instead of gold or power, and God was satisfied with his answer. It showed that he had the right to attain true wisdom.
When Solomon awoke, there were ten rings on his fingers, given as proof that he was deemed wise by God. 
Later they would be known as the Rings of Solomon, which become a source of magecraft that let one command angels and demons.

Chaldea's first successfully summoned Heroic Spirit.

The Grand Caster secretly summoned by Marisbury Animusphere that participated and achieved victory in the Fuyuki Holy Grail War.

His wish on the Holy Grail was to become human.
He did not use the power of the Grail to incarnate as a Heroic Spirit, but instead, abandoned all his powers as a Heroic Spirit to be reborn as a new human that had nothing to do with King Solomon.

His new name was Romani Archaman.
A normal young man who wanted only to live a normal life as an individual.

...But even in his second life, he was never to know the happiness and fulfillment that came with being human.
The vision of humanity's destined end, which he glimpsed right before becoming human, stole away all of his freedom.

"Class Skills"

Territory Creation: A
The ability for a mage to create a territory that benefits them.
The techniques he developed while building the Temple of Israel granted him the highest level of power in this skill.

Rapid Casting: C
The ability to speed up magecraft casting. He is fast, but he stresses over things and the pressure causes him to make mistakes.

Item Construction: C
The ability to create magically enhanced tools. Perhaps due to his specialized contract, his tool creation ability remained at an average level.

Introverted. Strong-willed. Passive.
An easy-going king who seems incapable of taking things seriously.
Strong-willed though he may be, this is only because he is unable to read the room.
For this reason, he ends up making bullish comments, but is actually a coward at heart. He is earnest but never serious, and lives his life using only 80% of his full potential.
It is astonishing that he managed to judge men and laws, and was a good ruler of his nation. He may have lacked spirit, but he was loved by his people for his wisdom, kindness, and affection for them.

...But none of these characteristics were of Solomon's own choosing.
Solomon was destined to be a king from birth, and he had no choice but to hear the voice of God and do as He said.
The king was an unemotional, inhuman person who was stripped of his ability to sympathize with the sorrows and joys of others.

Only after becoming a human named Roman did Solomon gain human nature. 
He is, at his core, more of a realist and pessimist.
He will say optimistic things to try and keep others' spirits up, but since he does not really mean it, he comes off as insincere.
He likes humans, but since he is a coward who does not want to experience sadness, he keeps all his relationships at a superficial level.
At the same time, this gives him the ability to get along with anyone.
When things get bad, he has a bad habit of observing without making decisions or simply ignoring things in order to maintain the status quo. 
Since Roman himself realizes that this is a weakness of his, a single encouraging word from someone around him can cause him to regain control and make decisive choices worthy of the King of Mages.

By the way, every Servant's first impression of him is along the lines of, "I don't know why, but this is his fault," and they would subconsciously find things to complain about.
The only ones who did not complain were non-Servants, contrarians, and Berserkers who do not recognize evil as evil.

『Ars Nova』
Rank: D  
NP Type: Anti-Personnel
The Time of Parting Hath Come, I Am He Who Surrenders the World.
The first Noble Phantasm of King Solomon.
A Noble Phantasm possessed by the true King Solomon, not Goetia.
An aria that relinquishes all his great deeds, miracles, and magecraft that he achieved in his life.

By activating this Noble Phantasm, Solomon returns the blessings that God bestowed on him back to Heaven, and loses the eyes that watch over the world.
The result is the death of King Solomon.
And in turn, the self-destruction of the 72 Demon Gods.
It can be described as a "safety device" put in place by King Solomon in case such a time comes when magecraft becomes a threat to humanity in the distant future, allowing him to destroy it.
When this is used as a Noble Phantasm, all traces of King Solomon disappear from this world.
...even from the Throne of Heroes.

Beast III/R.
A new type of heaven or deity calling itself the Freely Joyous, Third Outer Thought Pleasure of Heaven, that has taken form as one of the Evils of Humanity in FGO.

The true boss in Fate/EXTRA CCC.
In that iteration, she used BB to fuse with Mooncell and transformed into a true devil.
The horns growing from her head are diabolical. In other words, they signify that she is the antagonist of the Enlightened One.

A being of pure narcissism who values only pleasure.
A calamity that destroys both humans and animals, that uses, consumes, and absorbs all life for its own selfish desires.

Any who learn of this woman can at first see only her saintlike benevolence, and join the faith as she utterly enthralls them. As time goes on, members of the faith grow increasingly indulgent in pursuit of their desires, hoping for nothing more than her love. Their desires fade, though, even as they are fulfilled. That slow fading, however, does not please her, and eventually every follower falls from her good graces. Despairing that she will never love them, they end their own lives. So her victims' bodies and fortunes all belong to her in the end.

She is a being of pure evil, and yet insists with absolute conviction that her actions are in fact good.
While she would never lie to herself, she preys on all around her with honeyed, poisonous lies, and consumes everything in her path. Her surety and doubtless ego have brought her to true enlightenment, at least from the perspective of a layman. If one were to think of her as a saint, that could be the only reason why.

Multi-Colored Tranquility: EX
A belief outside Buddhist teachings that Kiara used in a certain digital world.
It was a medical software program intended to separate an individual's body, mind, and soul to lay the soul bare (to strip it of the body and mind's protection), then the therapist could listen to the individual's troubles and heal their suffering.
Obviously, this was simply a front.
Bereft of its protection, the defenseless soul is separated from the bonds of the body and mind, and absorbed into Kiara. Kiara savors her victim's soul all while claiming she has done so in the name of providing salvation. It is the ultimate version of Charm, the power of absolute, implicit trust. By becoming a Beast, her powers have increased tremendously.

Wearing the crown of a Beast, or Mara, which is an obstacle for Buddhist practice, Kiara's beauty as the Demonic Bodhisattva shatters the sanity, reasoning, and morality of any who lay eyes on her. The moment an individual lays eyes on Kiara, they must make a sanity check—a SAN save, or "Kiara save"—to determine whether they retain their sanity and sense of self. If successful, vision, taste, hearing, smell, and sensation are all preserved. However, the moment they think of Kiara as beautiful, all is lost. When this happens, all sense of self is gone, and after a brief bout of dizziness, one's sense of equilibrium and reality simply evaporates. They are then doomed to become one of Kiara's many followers, already held within her palm.

Multi-Colored Tranquility: EX
Open your eyes, and you will see a flesh-colored
plain that sprawls across endlessly.
You stand in the palm of the Demonic
Bodhisattva.
At the far end of the horizon, Kiara gently smiles.

"Humanity is nothing but young beasts.
Ephemeral fruit that devours, melts, and drowns in
their desires."

If this goddess embraces such bestial beings with the tenderness of a Bodhisattva, who could deny this great and infinite love?
 
Enlightenment and Nirvana are hers to command. Your final destination is the paradise that is Sessyoin.

...As you can see, no matter how strong you are, you are powerless before the heavenly demon. All beings possessed of reason, who understand joy and suffering, find themselves unable to resist the call of the salvation she offers. It is, of course, no salvation at all. Sweet as it sounds to call it the benevolence of the Bodhisattva, that is only how her victims can understand it. To Kiara, those held in her palm are no more than insects.

Authority of Beasts: A
Also called an "anti-humanity" skill.
While she is a Beast, the skill is rank A, but when she becomes an Alter Ego, it falls to rank D.

Logos Eater: EX
An aspect of Kiara as the deity of pleasure.
A specialized skill derived from Multi-Colored Stagnated Pleasure.
It is a specialized attack that inflicts powerful damage to all beings that capable of pleasure, no matter their size or structure. This skill is also said to greatly diminish in rank when she becomes an Alter Ego. Should its rank be reduced to C, it becomes no more than a tantalizing caress, like foreplay.

Nega-Saver: A
The final days of the Beast who tried to save only her own world, even while possessing the qualifications of a Saver.
All skills possessed by Saver and Ruler Classes are nullified, 300% probability to Charm anybody with a MP rank lower than A, and Kiara's buff effectiveness increases by 200%.

Karmaphage: EX
When Kiara converted her own body into SE.RA.PH, her five senses...her erogenous zones...were split into various skills and given to others.
The process is thought to be similar and copied the way BB created the Alter Egos when she deemed her love for humans to be superfluous.
It is abbreviated as KP, and the Sentinels were named "body," "site," "mouth," "spice," and "organ." Each of these Sentinels is forced to use Kiara's Authority, making them extraordinarily powerful Servants.

Heaven's Hole
A subtype of the Third Magic.
It has the ability to draw in matter with incredibly powerful gravity on the level of a black hole, but it's said to be nothing but a hole for waste, such as the unfavorable aspects people retain even as they do good deeds. The "Hole of the Heavens" embraces all the negative information associated with humanity's egocentricity, or all the world's greed, and continues to grow. They are undoubtedly hideous deposits, but this hole is an indispensable structure in society. As long as intellectual activity persists, it will continue to grow.
It will continue to contain the ugly desires that should not be present in humans.

Love is a good thing. And greed is a good thing.
But when love becomes greed for pleasure, it ceases to be good. Love and greed should always be separate. But when the soul of the savior who loved and wished to please humanity gained the Third Magic, Sessyoin Kiara became something inhuman. All living things in the world could be saved through pleasure, and so she pursued the ultimate salvation in an effort to become the recipient of such pleasure. Seven billion lives were gathered into herself, used solely so that she might reach her climax. Without peering into the future, without ever imagining an end to her delight, she simply tried to save humanity with pleasure alone. 

Ruled as she was by such desires, her class was determined. "Deity of pleasure" is simply a false address. She is the greatest calamity that tried to save humanity in an earnest quickie, relying on the twisted conclusion she reached herself. She is Beast III/R, one of the Seven Evils of Humanity, and the Beast associated with sexual desire.

condMessage: Unlock after clearing "Tokugawa Restoration Labyrinth, Ooku"
comment:
Beast III/L.

While Beast III/R is the embodiment of narcissism who spreads through the universe by directing all love inward to herself, this Beast is the embodiment of loving others by directing love outward toward all mankind to drain the universe.

Kama/Mara may act and talk oppressive, sadistic, and condescending, but no matter who she is, she is still able to "love" as well as being able to twist others into wild sensual madness. Yet this love is not offered for its object's benefit. Kama/Mara's Bestial nature comes not from corrupting others by drowning them in love, but by using love itself to corrupt them.

condMessage: Unlock after clearing "Tokugawa Restoration Labyrinth, Ooku"
comment: Originally a Divided Spirit who was only a part of the Divine Spirit Kama/Mara, this Pseudo-Servant manifested by borrowing a human form. While it may not have been a conscious move, the body of the vessel was split into good and evil by Pārvatī. Thus, this version of Kama incarnated in the evil aspect of the body. This is also why the Servant turned out as a female deity.

condMessage: Unlock after clearing "Tokugawa Restoration Labyrinth, Ooku"
comment: Kama/Mara is compatible with the emotion of love, but she is multifaceted and also carries the opposite aspects of negativity. Her existence was unstable to begin with, but her divine core mixed with love and suffering and the vessel's destiny synched up, resulting in her gaining a more stable Spirit Origin. Typically the ratio of Kama to Mara is about 6:4. Much like other Divine Spirit Servants such as Ishtar, the vessel's characteristics (personality and disposition) are retained, but not their persona (record).

condMessage: Unlock after clearing "Tokugawa Restoration Labyrinth, Ooku"
comment:
The typical ratio of Kama and Mara is 6:4, but when the proportion heavily leans towards Mara, the Spirit Origin awakens as a Beast. While Kama gained a physical body of the universe, that also meant that her counterpart, the Demon King Mara, also gained the power of the boundless realm (universe). The Demon King of lust connected to the universe simultaneously as the god of love did so, which resulted in a horrendous catastrophe. Kama thus became a manifestation of calamity, a being that the universe itself with love and desire, which meant she was more than qualified to become the immature form of a Beast capable of destroying humanity.
Beast III/R, the Beast of lust, is among the Seven Evils of Humanity to have already manifested. And then, as various chain of events connected...

While sharing the same principles of lust, unlike the Beast that directs all love to herself, this Kama/Mara goes the complete opposite direction. She manifests as an immature Beast that gives love to all...by taking away love (normally directed to humans who are loved).

condMessage: Unlock after clearing "Tokugawa Restoration Labyrinth, Ooku"
comment:
Authority of Beasts: A
Also called an "anti-humanity" skill.
As an Assassin, Kama does not possess this skill.
...Or perhaps it secretly belongs to Mara.

Accepting All Greed: EX
Normally, Kama/Mara is prepared both physically and ability-wise on multiple levels in order to ready herself for the endless human greed (lust) that covers this world. And now, with the inclusion of the universe, which is truly boundless, its next-level countermeasures came into being by targeting something very specific.

It's an Authority that is able to specifically target the greed (lust) of each and every person in the universe, indulges them, and corrupts them. The theory is that the Authority is readily customizable, and just like the infinite number of stars in space, there are an endless number of selves that can deal with all.

In other words, Kama/Mara exists infinitely within the universe that is herself.

Nega-Desire: A
A potent skill unique and native to the Beast of Desire. No matter the target, anything that has even a modicum of greed will be corrupted by love itself. If all desire and lust that exist in the universe can be granted through infinite love, that would also mean that the concept of greed can be eliminated from this universe.

condMessage: Unlock after clearing "Tokugawa Restoration Labyrinth, Ooku"
comment:
She was mandated to be intimately involved with the love affairs of all the world, and was annihilated after getting involved in said affairs... The god of love, as a result, gained infinity, and naturally became weary of love. Thus, she tries to fulfill everything using her own infinite love. After all, if the universe (humanity) is fulfilled by her love, then there would be no further annoyance of the love affairs between people that so irk her.

This Beast scatters passion (or arrows of it) throughout humanity that are sufficient to burn the universe. Anything goes. It doesn't matter how low they stoop. Love them through and through even if they are corrupted to the point of becoming animals. Embrace them. That kind of ultimate pampering is what Kama/Mara can offer. She offers love (temptation) as she once did for Buddha...but now to each and every person of this universe.

"The vow to cut off all vexations...must be so hard on you. Don't worry, I'll burn all your worries away."

The sight of her enjoying herself by scorning the Buddha's vow with a smile is the very image of the Demon King, the great enemy in Buddhism.

And so, based on her original nature, her class was determined:
The god of love is a false name.
The byproduct of a god of evil...the greatest catastrophe that is said to save humanity itself.
Her name: Beast III/L.
She is one of the Seven Evils of Humanity, the Beast possessing the aspect of lust.

condMessage: Unlock after clearing "Tokugawa Restoration Labyrinth, Ooku"
comment:
『Saṃsāra Kama/Mara Avaruddha』
Rank: EX
NP Type: Anti-World
Range: 100 - 99999
Maximum Targets: 1

The Realm of Love, The Burning Universe.
The Noble Phantasm exclusive to Beast III/L. Unusually, it has two True Names. This is to indicate that they are two sides of the same coin. The word saṃsāra means "cycle" in Sanskrit, and it's derived from Kama's other name, Samsaraguru. Avaruddha in Sanskrit means "obstruction," and it points to Mara's many attempts to interfere with Buddha...the temptation towards corruption.

Coercing the indulgences of love that are both good and bad... The ultimate corruptive Noble Phantasm that represents both Kama and Mara, who possess demonic natures on a cataclysmic level. When one experiences this Noble Phantasm inside Kama's universe, they will undoubtedly behold a true hell—or perhaps paradise—of Kama sending herself (or copies of herself) to all without discrimination, and burning up the universe with her one-sided love to exhaust her targets.

Beast IV: L originally came into being as the collective death throes of the land and animals that died during the Tunguska incident. The pain of the land that was literally blown away... The cries of the animals that were killed in an instant, helpless in the face of their fate... These all mixed together into a residual Spirit Origin, or prototypical Singularity, if you prefer, that remained at ground zero as a distortion in spacetime.

If that was all there was to her story, she may well have faded away with no one else even knowing she existed. But on January 1st, 2019, when the previous Beast IV abdicated his position, she was included in the candidates to fill his seat, and transformed into an Evil of Humanity. She took on a new Alter Ego Spirit Origin using Tamamo-no-Mae, a Nature Spirit, as a reference, and began undertaking efforts to wipe out humankind. Her goal in doing so was to act on the collective will of all animals (including humans, of course) and sever all connections with the human world. In a sense, it was not unlike someone filing for divorce against their spouse.

Her ultimate goal was to build a world of new animals in Earth's existing environments where the animals would not hurt humans, nor where humans would hurt the animals, and to stay there as she watched modern humanity go extinct.

Though she may have the body of a Beast, her true form is that of the earth itself. As a being who simultaneously oversees both a zone full of animal life, and a zone where animals are slaughtered and killed, it would not be inaccurate to describe Beast IV as the Eighth Lostbelt.

The mother of beasts considers humankind unnecessary. Although she is cruel and cold, and she would never outwardly show it, her love for animals is genuine and deep. Nonetheless, as the embodiment of the unforgiving natural world, she would (almost) never coddle them. Furthermore, despite her inherent cruelty, she is still Tamamo-no-Mae at heart, which means she is also just a little bit of a softie.

As a rule, she has no respect for human rights, and is actively working towards wiping out all of humankind. Yet although she hates the human species, and finds everything humans do disgusting, she doesn't hate them because they're dirty. If anything, there are some pleasures that can only be enjoyed because they're dirty.
"I don't hate every last human, you know. There's at least one exception."
"Really!? Who!?"
"Hugh Hefner."
"...Who's that?"

True Goal
A mysterious beauty who knew the Foreign God's real identity, yet still chose to present herself as a collaborator. She doesn't care whether the Foreign God erases Proper Human History, or if one of the Lostbelts takes its place. This is because, as a juvenile Beast, she doesn't necessarily want to wipe out humankind herself; she just wants to enjoy watching them fade out of existence.

As a candidate to become the new Beast IV, she is something of a rival to Primate Murder, the original Beast IV. (Remember, Beast IV is an Evil of Humanity who's all about nature and animals.)

Small Public-Facing Goals
An evil, capable woman who tried her hand at eliminating Chaldea herself even as she cheered on the Crypters as a Disciple of the Foreign God. Unlike the other Alter Egos, she has the ability to travel freely between Lostbelts.

Grand Secret Goal
To travel around the various Lostbelts as an Alter Ego and collect grotesque monsters unique to each Lostbelt. Beast IV: L stores the monsters she collects in her tails, where they then become familiars she can generate from that tail whenever she likes.
Her reason for doing so is to copy the legend of the great nine-tailed fox, which is said to have birthed every last inhuman monstrosity that lives in Japan from its tails. However, she also thought that merely copying the legend would be boring, so...

"As one who refuses to tolerate humanity in any way, shape, or form, my children should all be creatures who never existed in their history."

That's right. That is the reason why Beast IV: L went out of her way to make familiars out of life-forms that could only survive in Lostbelts. It was for that purpose that she went from Lostbelt to Lostbelt killing the monsters that lived there and incorporating them into her tails.
She gained a new tail with every set of Lostbelt information she acquired, and can now freely use her Russian, Scandinavian, and Chinese tails to generate and control enemies from each of those Lostbelts.
Every such enemy Beast IV: L produces has an NFF Services sticker on it, so that there can be no doubt as to where they come from.

Independent Manifestation: B
A skill that allows one to manifest in the world without outside help.
Although Beast IV: L did not come into existence through human society flourishing, she still gained this skill by virtue of coming to Earth as a meteorite from space. As a being from a different world (or zone), Beast IV: L was easily able to break through the walls surrounding each Lostbelt's world and jump between them as she pleased.

Authority of Beasts: E
Also called an "anti-humanity" skill. This is what gives Beast IV: L her Beast trait while she's stepping into her Fair-faced Golden Fox aspect.

Nega-Self: C
An Authority that denies the consciousness and will in animals.
Although the Beast of Affection generated and discharged the various animals she had incorporated from her own cells, she not only forbade them from creating families and geneologies, she even refused to let them have their own sense of self. In effect, she forbids all of her kin from ever evolving through growth, experience, or mixing their DNA.

Morph: EX
The ability to transform not only herself, but even every creature born from her body. This also enables her to arrange her "children's" DNA and create brand new life-forms.

Although Koyanskaya was originally thought to be a Disciple of the Foreign God and one of her three Alter Egos, the truth turned out to be very different. In fact, she intentionally acted in such a way as to make Chaldea think that was the case.

On January 1st, 2019, after the Incineration of Humanity incident, a juvenile Beast of Affection independently manifested in Russia as one of the candidates to take Beast IV's place.
While it's easy to think she may be one of the Tamamo Nine, since she looks so much like Tamamo-no-Mae, that too was just an intentional red herring. She's actually a Nature Spirit made up of all the pain and suffering of the animals that died, and the nature that was harmed, during the Tunguska incident of 1908; the collective thoughts and feelings of animals persecuted by humans incarnated into physical form. During that incarnation, she chose Tamamo-no-Mae's Spirit Origin for her vessel, since she believed her and Tamamo to be two tails of a fox (i.e. Beasts who lived to take revenge on humans).
Even Tamamo-no-Mae herself was so convinced Koyanskaya was so much like her that she thought she might be her Alter, despite having no recollection of Koyanskaya being one of her tails.

Shortly after she founded her company for the purpose of wiping out humanity, she was contacted by the Foreign God, where they formed a contract of mutual non-interference with the other's goal. From then on, she acted as though she was fully on board the Foreign God's plan, even doing her part to help further it.
But in fact, despite her originally manifesting in order to fill the vacant Beast IV seat, it seems what Koyanskaya really wanted was to enjoy watching Chaldea and the Foreign God fall at each others' hands rather than compete directly with either of them herself.

Incidentally, her ears are not fox ears, but rabbit ears. As rabbits exist solely to be prey, and since she contains a rabbit's soul deep down in her core, she has no sympathy for predators regardless of whether she's allied with them, and has a small soft spot for prey.

In the confrontation between the Foreign God and Chaldea, Koyanskaya's ultimate goal was to sweep in after one had lost, absorb them both, and become a new Evil of Humanity. Not as Beast IV: L, but as herself.
If Koyanskaya had had her way, she would have liked nothing more than for Chaldea to emerge victorious so she could sew the Master who saved humankind to her body as her ninth tail, followed by making them watch as humanity was finally destroyed. "Now that would be the perfect cherry on top♡"

...But then, in the Sixth Lostbelt, her friend Murian asked her to protect Faerie Britain, and to do so required her to shield Chaldea (or in this case, the Storm Border) from Cernunnos's hands, for they were the only ones capable of bringing Britain salvation. Right after doing so, she was injected with the stagnation Cernunnos had built up thanks to Oberon's plot, causing her Spirit Origin to swell in size. No longer able to control her own power, Koyanskaya was then forced to retreat from the Sixth Lostbelt.
Afterwards, she escaped to the Anti-Primate Biosphere she had been building in secret on the bleached-white Earth, where she then had no choice but to begin metamorphosing into her fully-grown form, despite knowing it was still too soon.

　　　◆

Although Koyanskaya did succeed in becoming an Evil of Humanity, she remained immature and half-grown at heart, thereby ensuring she could never become a disaster for all of humanity. This is also why she has no Beast name, for as the Beast of Taming she couldn't bring herself to attack humanity directly.
It is for these reasons that she was unable to become the class she wanted, and why she is a far cry from the nation-ruining beauty she claims to be. In the end, Beast IV: Lost turned out to be no more than a biosphere walking hand in hand with human history, unable to completely forsake humankind. She is merely a beast with an affectionate side who failed to become the seventh Evil of Humanity.
